Title: Grotte et ancienne cave à fromage de Matharel
Description:
Grotte et ancienne cave à fromage de Matharel
 
        La cache se situe près de Gréponac au-dessus de Tournemire.
        Une lampe est indispensable pour admirer la grotte.
        D'octobre à Mars inclu, il faut respecter la période d'hibernation des chauve-souris et ne pas pénétrer au-delà de l'entrée.

 

         
              La grotte se profile le long d'une vaste galerie de 400m qui a été utilisée en cave à fromage jusqu'à la Seconde guerre Mondiale.
         La cache se situe dans la première salle de la grotte, dans un angle de la pièce sous une pierre. Il s'agit d'une boîte en plastique transparente qui contient un log-book, un crayon et divers objets. Bien refermer et bien remettre la cache en place. Merci.
         Je vous souhaite une bonne balade,
                                                               Valyetserge.
 
 

- L'entrée de la grotte -

Title: Vilenica Cave
Description:
Vilenica Cave

General information:
Vilenica is the oldest cave in Europe. It was named after haze lifting above its entrance and dancing like mythological creatures - fairies.The cave consists of three morphologically characteristic parts, all of them transformed by breakdowns.Vilenica is about 800 m long cave with denivelation of about 180 m. The cave is well decorated with a series of nice speleothems. The cave is noted for large halls and rich flowstone decoration. There are many nice draperies. A gigantic stalagmite having 10 m in diameter in its lower part, probably the largest speleothem (speleothems are cave formations such as stalactites and stalagmites) in Slovenia, is an outstanding feature in this cave.
     
Geological information and uniqueness of the cave:
The first part is very large and strongly controlled by breakdown. The central part is smaller and the third part, consisting of the Fabrisov Rov gives an impression of a large, inclined fissure. There is an outstanding stalagmite. Stalagmite is a type of speleothem that rises from the floor of a limestone cave to the dripping of mineralized solutions the deposition of calcium carbonate. 
According to old beliefs, fairies lived in the bottom of the cave giving the name to it (vila (fairy) - Vilenica). The final part named Fabrisov Rov, is accessible to cavers only. In this part there are red stalactites covered by white helictites. A helictite is a speleothem found in limestones caves that changes its axis from the vertical at one or more stages during its growth. They have a curving or angular form that looks as if they were grown zero gravity. Helictites are, perhaps, the most delicate of cave formations. In this cave they are made of needle calcite (can be aragonite). Forms of helictites have been described in several types like ribbon, saws, rods, curly-fries, but in this cave they are like butterflies. They can be very easily crushed or broken by the slightest touch. Becouse of this, helictites are rarely seen within arm's reach in tourist caves. 
The main body of the cave has developed inside a fissure zone. Irrespective of how the primary passages inside this zone were directed, ceiling collapses are mostly controlled by faults. A fault is a planar fracture or discontiunity in a volume of rork, accross which there has been significant displacement.
It is interesting that the orientation of the show part is almost entirely perpendicular to recent underground conduits. The divergence may be explained by the great age of the cave and it is quite possible that the underground water flows that shaped it, were oriented differently than today. A hypothesis exists that the accessible cave makes just one part of former bigger cave system. Anyway due to intensive passage collapse the information about the original conditions are in many places completely blurred. 
 
Access to the cave:
from the main road is approximately 200m. There is nice parking place (see the reference point). The cave is not open every day. Opening hours are described in the spoiler picture (info table picture)
Please send me your responses to the logging tasks (email Aucoin.J@seznam.cz), then go ahead and log this EarthCache. You do not need to wait for my response to post your log. If there is a problem with your log or logging tasks, I will contact you. Please do not include any information in your log that may spoil the logging tasks for others.
1. how high is the gigantic stalagmite and doest it have name? Describe the colour of  the gigantic stalagmite.
2. how did this gigantic stalagmite grow and how long did it take? 
Take a picture of youself with GPS showing the infotable in the background. See reference point for infotable spot. The picture is optional.
Slovenščina – Splošne informacije in geologija:
 Vilenica je najstarejša turistično urejena jama v Evropi. Ime je dobila po meglicah nad vhodom, ki so videti kot ples mitoloških bitij - vil. Zato so bili ljudje prepričani, da v jami živijo vile. Jama je sestavljena iz treh morfološko bistvenih delov, ki so bili preoblikovani zaradi vode in ponorov kakšnega (občasnega) potoka. Vilenica je več kot 800 m dolga jama z denivelacijo dobrih 180 m. Jama je bogato okrašena z vrsto lepih kapnikov. Znana je po velikih dvoranah in bogati dekoraciji sigastih tvorb. Še posebej so lepe jamske zavese in velikanski stalagmit s premerom 10 metrov v njegovem spodnjem delu, verjetno največja kapniška tvorba v Sloveniji.
 Prvi del jame je bil močno preoblikovan s ponorom. Osrednji del je manjši. Zadnji del daje vtis velikega, poševnega zloma. V zadnjem delu jame lahko najdemo izjemni stalagmit. Stalagmit je kapnik, ki raste iz tal in nastaja s kapljanjem vode iz stropa in izločanjem kalcijevega karbonata iz nje. Tretji del se zaključi s Fabrisovim rovom, ki je dostopen samo jamarjem. V tem delu so rdeči stalaktiti, prekriti z belimi helictiti. To so apnenčaste tvorbe, ki spreminjajo svojo rast od vertikalne v več stopnjah. Zato imajo skrivljeno ali kotno obliko, ki daje vtis, kot da so brez težnosti. V tej jami so narejeni iz igel kalcita (lahko tudi aragonita). So morda ena od najbolj občutljivih jamskih tvorb. Že ob najmanjšem stiku se jih lahko zmečka ali zdrobi. Zato se jih v turističnih jamah tudi redko vidi na dosegu roke obiskovalcev. Oblike helictitov opisujejo glede na obliko kot trak, žaga, palica, kodrčki, krompirček, toda v tej jami so podobni metuljem.
 Glavni del jame se je razvil znotraj območja razpoke. Ne glede na to, kako so bile prvotno razporejeni prehodi znotraj tega območja, je na mestih prelomnic prišlo do zrušitev stropov. Prelomnica je  zlom ali prekinitev v skalni masi, do katere pride zaradi vzdolžnih zlomov, ki so posledica zemeljskega gibanja.
 Zanimivo je, da je usmeritev vidnih delov skoraj povsem pravokotna na mlajše podzemne vode. Razlike je mogoče pojasniti z veliko starostjo jame, zaradi katerih je dokaj možno, da so bile podzemne vode, ki so jih oblikovale, usmerjene drugače kot so danes. Domnevajo, da je današnja jama samo del nekdanjega večjega jamskega sistema. Kakorkoli, zaradi intenzivnih podorov so podatki o prvotnem izgledu podzemlja v tem delu na veliko delih povsem zabrisani.   
Dostop do jame:
Od glavne ceste je jama oddaljena približno 200m. Pred vhodom je urejeno parkirišče (glej referenčno tocko). Jama ni odprta vsak dan. Čase ogledov si lahko pogledate na sliki spodaj, kjer je slika informacijske table.
 Prosim, pošljite mi odgovor na postavljena vprašanja na e-mail: Aucoin.J@seznam.cz, potem pa lahko logiraš svojo najdbo. Ni vam treba čakati dovoljenja. Če bodo težave pri odgovorih, bom stopil v stik z vami. Prosim, da v log ne pišete odgovorov na vprašanja, s katerimi bi drugim onemogočili, da samostojno rešijo nalogo.
 Vprašanja:
1. Kako visok je največji kapnik v jami in ali ima kakšno ime? Opišite barvo tega velikanskega stalagmita.
2. Kako je ta velikanski stalagmit rastel in kako star je?
Neobvezno pripnite k svojemu logu sliko sebe in svoje gps naprave pred informacijsko tablo (glej spoiler sliko).

Title: La mine de plomb argentifère de La Plagne
Description:
La mine de plomb argentifère de la Plagne


Situation et mode de gisement. Le nom de La Plagne a acquis une notoriété nationale et même internationale depuis que la création, en 1963, d'une station « up to date » y attire une foule de fervents. Combien, parmi ceux qui se livrent avec griserie à leur sport favori, se doutent-ils qu'au-dessous de leurs gracieuses arabesques, la montagne est taraudée par tout un réseau de puits et galeries qu'y a creusé un contingent de mineurs voué à des tâches qui comptent parmi les plus rebutantes ? Les ruisseaux de la Lovatière à l'Ouest et de l'Arc à l'Est enserrent un interfluve arrondi qui s'élève de leur confluence, au hameau de La Roche, vers 1 550 mètres, jusqu'à la crête des Colosses (2 141 m), et que tranche la limite entre la forêt de conifères et la prairie alpine. Son rebord oriental recèle un gisement de plomb argentifère connu depuis des temps immémoriaux et exploité jusqu'en février 1973 par la société Le Nickel-Penarroya.



Geologie

Nous sommes ici sur la ligne de contact entre la nappe permocarbonifère (ère du paléozoïque, il y a environ 300 millions d'années) dite briançonnaise dans laquelle est évidé le Berceau tarin et la nappe de la Vanoise et du Mont Pourri qui lui succède vers l'Est. Le passage se marque, sur l'emplacement même de la mine, par une discordance soulignée par des brèches tectoniques. A la première de ces nappes se rattache un synclinal de « schistes verts ou violets, finement feuilletés et à la surface luisante et talqueuse, attribués au Permien ! ». Le flanc occidental, redressé à la verticale, apparaît donc en affleurement, tandis que vers l'Est le pendage, variable mais compris entre 20 et 45°, traduit l'amorce d'un anticlinal gonflant le Houiller sous-jacent mais profondément enfoui sous la niasse des cargneules, calcaires cristallins, gypses et dolomies de la nappe chevauchante de la Vanoise. Le remplissage du synclinal consiste en quartzites, tantôt finement broyés jusqu'à être réduits en sables, tantôt cimentés en solides amas.
(Extrait du livre de Louis Chabert)


Les traces du sous-sol

Durant la ballade à La Plagne, plusieurs pierres fort différentes sont visibles sur les chemins et les coupes de roches. Les quartzites blancs légèrement translucides sont ceux qui contiennent des filons. Il y à également des pièrres vertes et des granits.
Voici une liste de roches que vous verrez sur les chemins de La Plagne:
- des micaschistes versicolores, verts à violacés, , chloriteux et quartzeux, à niveaux conglomératiques ou gneissiques. Ils constituent le "groupe d'Ambin" de J.Ganne) ; anciennement confondus avec les schistes volcano-détritiques que l'on connaît dans le Permien du Briançonnais plus méridional, on leur attribue maintenant un âge paléozoïque (Ordovicien ?).
- des micaschistes gris "de l'Arpont" (à Ambin = "groupe de la Claréa" de J.Ganne). Ils hébergent par places des intercalations de roches vertes, plus ou moins volcaniques, d'âge paléozoïque.
- des "micaschistes supérieurs", gris et noirs, parfois pyriteux et charbonneux à patine rouille. Ils comportent des passées de grauwackes et de prasinites.
- des "micaschistes moyens", alternés de bancs quartzeux (anciennes ignimbrites* ?) reposant sur une roche grenue verdâtre rapportée à un ancien gabbro* ;
- des "micaschistes inférieurs", formant un complexe rubané à alternances de roches vertes (anciennes spilites ?) et de strates quartzeuses.
(Extrait de GEO-ALPES de Maurice GIDON)




Pour logger valablement cette Earthcache, dites moi (par mail via mon profil)

Quel numero est sur la plaque bleue de la cabine électirique ?
Quel café à gauche de la mine ?
Quel est le nom du chalet à gauche de la mine ?
Quelle lettre sur le chalet à droite de la mine ?

Quelle est la couche de couleur grise sur le panneau informatif
Quel terme géologique est utilisé pour les sables
Quel pourcentage de plomb dans le minerai à l'extraction
Une photo de vous à l'entrée de la mine est toujours la bienvenue!



Location and mode of occurrence.

The name of La Plagne acquired a national and even International reputation since the inception in 1963. The station attracts a crowd of enthusiasts. How many of those who engage in their favorite sport, suspect that below their graceful arabesques, the mountain is tapped by a network of shafts and tunnels dug by a contingent of miners dedicated to tasks that are among the most repulsive? The streams Lovatière of the Western and Eastern Arc enclose a round interfluve rising from their confluence, the hamlet of La Roche, 1550 meters to the crest of the Colossus (2141 m), and slice the boundary between the coniferous forest and alpine meadow. Its eastern edge holds a silver-lead deposit that has been known for time immemorial and operated until February 1973 by Le Nickel-Penarroya.

Geology

We are here on the line of contact between the water from the Brianconnais 300 million years ago which is called the Cradle, an hollow tarin and ground of the Vanoise and Mont Pourri succeeding to the east. The transition is marked on the site of the mine by discrepancy highlighted by tectonic breccias. At the first of these sheets relates a syncline "green or purple shale, finely laminated and glistening surface talc, attributed to Permian! ". The western flank, upright vertically, thus appears flush, while the dip to the east, variable but included between 20 and 45 °, reflecting the start of an anticline inflating the Carboniferous underlying but deeply buried under the mass of cargneules, crystalline limestone, gypsum and dolomite of the water of overlapping Vanoise. The filling consists of quartzite of the syncline, sometimes finely ground to be reduced to sand, sometimes cemented solid mass.

Traces of the basement

During the ride to La Plagne, several stones are visible on very different paths and rock cuts. The slightly translucent white quartzites are those that contain veins. There are also green stones and granite.

Here is a list of rocks that you see on the road to La Plagne:
- Variegated mica schists, green to purplish,, chlorite and quartz, with conglomeratic levels or gneissic. They are the "group Ambin" by J. Ganne), formerly confused with volcano-clastic shale which is known in the Permian of southernmost Briançon, they are now issuing Paleozoic (Ordovician?).
- The white mica "the Arpont" (to Ambin = "group of Clara" by J. Ganne). They host some places intercalations greenstone, more or less volcanic Paleozoic age.
- The "upper mica", gray and black, pyritic and sometimes smoky patina rust. They include past and greywackes prasinites.
- The "mica means" alternating quartz bench (old ignimbrites *?) Based on a grainy greenish rock related to a former gabbro *;
- The "lower mica", forming a complex with alternating banded greenstone (spilites old?) And quartz layers.

To log this properly Earthcache, tell me (by mail via my profile)

What is the layer of gray on the information board
What term is used for geological sands
What percentage of lead in ore extraction

What pub is left of the mine?
What name is on the building left from the mine?
What letter is on the building on the right side of the mine?

A picture of you in front of the entry of the mine is always welcome.

Title: little cave
Description:
Waterberging en ecologische verbindingszone Molenbeek
Situatie
De Molenbeek ligt tussen Roosendaal en de Belgische grens. De beek ontspringt in België vanuit de Kleine Aa en de Wildertse beek, loopt stroomafwaarts door het stedelijk gebied van Roosendaal en mondt uiteindelijk uit in de Roosendaalse haven. De beek stroomt grotendeels door een open agrarisch landschap en is in het verleden rechtgetrokken. Uitzondering hierop is het tracé tussen de Belgische grens en Nispen, waar de Molenbeek nog meandert. Bij hoge afvoeren ontstaan met name ten zuiden van Roosendaal en op Belgisch grondgebied wateroverlast. De waterkwaliteit van de beek is mede door lozingen en overstorten uit België ontoereikend. De Molenbeek is aangewezen als ecologische verbindingszone.

Waterdoelen

•De oevers en aangrenzende gronden van de Molenbeek inrichten als ecologische verbindingszone
•Langs de beek ruimte creëren voor waterberging
•Stuwen vispasseerbaar maken (doelstelling vanuit Kaderrichtlijn Water)
•Waterkwaliteit verbeteren (doelstelling vanuit Kaderrichtlijn Water)

Title: La grotte du coléoptère
Description:
La caverne elle-même est de petite dimension. C'est une cavité de type ascendant, qui est par conséquent favorable à la conservation de la chaleur.



La salle d'entrée, qui constitue l'essentiel de la grotte, pouvait former une surface habitable d'environ 20 m2 à l'époque paléolithique.
La morphologie de la terrasse qui s'étend aujourd'hui devant la grotte est d'origine anthropique récente.



Les observations effectuées au cours des fouilles permettent de lui attribuer une surface habitée égale à 4 ou 5 fois celle de la grotte, au maximum de l'occupation paléolithique.

Plus d'info ici

Title: St. John's Cave / Grotte di San Giovanni
Description:
The Cave of St. John is located in the municipality of Domusnovas, province of Carbonia-Iglesias, Sardinia.
The cave is a beautiful example of karst. The karst phenomena were generated by the flow of a subterraneous river that caused the collapse of limestone rock masses.
The Grotto has been recognized Natural Monument in 1999 and is unique in Italy, third in the world (after France and Australia) to be traveled by car, now closed to traffic and only open to pedestrians. Entrance is free and the cave is illuminated from 9.00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.
The main branch at street level is 850 m long and is fully crossed by the river St. John that drains the mountain valleys. It is characterized by stalactites and stalagmites in large rooms, the largest of these is situated near the north. In addition to the main part of the grotto branches on two levels (accessible only to experts) make it a 2000 meter long cave. They consist of a series of tunnels and passages with the presence of underground lakes and siphons.
Numerous artifacts have been found inside the cave, mainly of shards of pottery, indicating that the cave was used as a shelter. As an evidence of this there are the remains of pre-nuragic massive walls which aimed to fortify the entrances. In the south the walls are still visible.
Near the northern entrance – thanks to favorable climatic conditions – an abundant floral hygrophyte has developed.

  



To complete this Earth Cache please do the following:
1. Take a guess about the height of the northern monumental entrance to the valley of Oridda (from street level to the top). Email me your answer: Send Message
2. Without water karst phenomena wouldn't exist. Estimate the current flow rate of the river San Giovanni and tell me your answer (meters per second) in your e-mail.

3. Cross the cave and count the street lamps on both sides of the road (between the bollards at the entrances) and tell me the number in your e-mail.
4. Mention in your log whether you’ve been there alone or with how many others you have visited this location.
Taking a picture of you and your GPS in front of the cave or inside is optional but I'd appreciate any picture uploaded with your log.
Enjoy!

La Grotta di San Giovanni è ubicata nel territorio comunale di Domusnovas, provincia di Carbonia-Iglesias, in Sardegna.

La grotta è un bell'esempio di fenomeno carsico. Il fenomeno carsicò che la generò è dovuto allo scorrere di un fiume sottorraneo che ne provocò il cedimento di una massa calcarea rocciosa.

La Grotta è stato riconosciuta Monumento Naturale in 1999. È unica in Italia, terza in tutto il mondo (Dopo Francia e Australia) ad essere percorribile in auto (ora chiusa al traffico). L'ingresso è gratuito e la grotta è illuminata 9:00-21:00.

Il ramo principale (livello stradale) lungo 850 metri, interamente attraversato dal rio di San Giovanni che raccoglie le acque delle vallate a monte, è caratterizzato da ampie sale, da grandi concrezioni a vaschetta , la più grande di queste concrezioni si trova in prossimaità dell'uscita nord e da stalattiti e da stalagmiti. Oltre al ramo principale la grotta si sviluppa su altri due livelli, (accessibili solo agli esperti), rendendo la grotta lunga 2000 metri. Sono costituite da una serie di gallerie e passaggi con la presenza di laghi sotterranei e sifoni.

Numerosi reperti sono stati rinvenuti all'interno della grotta, si tratta principalmente di cocci di vasellame, a testimonianza che la cavità era utilizzata come rifugio. A testimonianza di ciò sono anche i resti delle possenti mura preistoriche, che aveno lo scopo di chiudere fortificando gli ingressi nord e sud. Nel sud le pareti sono ancora visibili.

Vicino all'ingresso del Nord - grazie alle favorevoli condizioni climatiche - un hygrophyte abbondante floreali si è sviluppata.

Per registrare la cache potrebbe essere necessario effettuare le seguenti operazioni:

1. Prendere una supposizione circa l'altezza del monumentale ingresso settentrionale alla valle di Oridda (dal livello della strada verso l'alto). Invia le risposte via e-mail: Send Message
2. Senza fenomeni carsici acqua non esisterebbe. Stimare il tasso attuale portata del rio San Giovanni e dimmi la tua risposta (metri al secondo) nella tua e-mail.

3. Attraversate la grotta e contare i lampioni su entrambi i lati della strada (tra i dissuasori all'ingresso) e dimmi il numero nella tua e-mail.

4. Menzione nel registro se ci sei stato da solo o con quanti altri che hanno visitato questa posizione.

Imagini sono naturalmente i benvenuti. Scattare una foto di voi e il vostro GPS davanti alla grotta o è dentro opzionale ma io apprezzo ogni immagine caricata con il vostro log.

Buon divertimento!

Title: The Cave
Description:
The Cave 2.0

Dieser Cache führt dich zu einer kleinen Höhle im Norden Gaishorns.


Edit: Der Weg zur Höhle ist, wegen der drohenden Hangrutschung und Umgrabungsarbeiten Ende Juli, nun nicht mehr so naturbelassen und schön wie vorher. Trotzdem werde ich den Cache nicht archivieren.
Weg:
Zuerst vom Parkplatz weg, nach Norden am Köberlbach entlanggehen. Es ist nur ein kurzer Weg bis zur höhle/Cache (ca. 2 - 3min), welche sich links des Baches (Blickrichtung Norden) befindet. Die Koordinaten lieegn nicht gaun in der Höhle sinder einige Meter daneben. Aber von den koordinaten aus kannst du die Höhle leicht ausfindig machen.

Der Cache
Der Cache verlangt ein gutes Auge um ihn zu finden mehr will ich nicht verraten ;)


!HAPPY HUNTING!

Title: Mick 02 - Le terril de Blegny-Mine
Description: Blegny-Mine le terril Le Charbonnage d'Argenteau-Trembleur est situé sur le territoire de Blegny, au Nord-Est de Liège, dans l'Avant-pays de Herve. Installé en pleine campagne, à une centaine de mètres au-dessus du niveau de la Meuse, il constitue la dernière concession houillère du nord du bassin liégeois. Par rapport à d'autres sièges d'extraction, Argenteau-Trembleur était caractérisé par une relativement faible profondeur, certaines couches affleurant même la campagne voisine. L'intérêt du site réside dans sa reconversion originale en domaine touristique, et dans la préservation de deux puits d'époques différentes (XIXème et XXème siècle). Le plus récent, toujours en service, donne accès aux galeries souterraines des étages -30 et -60 mètres, ouvert aux visites..

Title: ODK 06 Jama
Description:
Devínska Kobyla



Flóra

Časť III.
Znacná cast záujmového územia však nebola z fytocenologického hladiska preskúmaná. V druhovej skladbe vegetácie dominujú xerotermné a vápnomilné prvky. Celkove sa v oblasti Devínskej Kobyly zistilo vyše 1100 druhov vyšších rastlín, z toho 25 chránených. Osobitostou záujmového územia je výskyt rôznych druhov a krížencov fialiek a najmä bohaté zastúpenie celade vstavacovitých. Z celkového poctu 50 druhov sa na Devínskej Kobyle zistilo 26. Z chránených druhov rastlín sa castejšie vyskytujú hlavácik jarný, poniklec cernastý, p. velkokvetý, veternica lesná, lalia zlatohlavá , kavyl Ivanov, kavyl pôvabný, sinokvet mäkký, kosatec nízky, jasenec biely, drien, cerešna mahalebka, jasen mannový - prevažne vysádzaný, zriedkavejšie zlatofúz južný ), zimozelen bylinná, hrachor panónsky, vemenník dvojlistý, vzácne kosatec dvojfarebný, z celade vstavacovitých jazýckovec jadranský a modruška pošvatá , z krovín rešetliak skalný. Vzácnostou flóry Devínskej Kobyly sú dalej ihlica nízka , hrachor sférický , konringia rakúska , nátržník odnožený , smyrnium prerastenolisté, prerastlík okrúhlolistý , ostrôžka východná metlinatá a slezinník cierny .

Title: Jazvinska jaskyna/cave
Description:
Jazvinska jaskyna
Jazvinská jaskyna v Tribecskom pohorí, nazývaná tiež Debnárová jaskyna, sa nachádza pri osade Debnárov Štál patriacej do obce Malá Lehota. Prvá zmienka o Jazvinskej jaskyni pochádza z roku 1893 od Andreja Kmeta, vynikajúceho botanika a archeológa. Patrí k najznámejším puklinovo-riecnym jaskyniam v Kostoliansko-lehotskom krase s dutinami vertikálnej zóny s pohybujúcimi sa krasovými vodami a modelacnými podzemnými tokmi. Vznikla vplyvom vodných cinitelov na puklinách vo vápencoch stredného triasu tvoriacich obalovú sériu Tribeca. Tiahne sa vodorovne vo vápencovom masíve do vzdialenosti 44m a pokracuje úzkou puklinou. Jej výzdobu tvoria skrasovatené pukliny a sintrová výpln.
Pre nepriechodnost podzemných priestorov a zanesenému dnu splavenými sedimentmi z jej povrchu bola jaskyna prekopávaná v rokoch 1973, 1974, 1975, 1988 a 1989. Jazvinská jaskyna dnes patrí k najkrajším podzemným prírodným krásam Tribecského pohoria.

Z jaskyne tiez pochádza nález rímskej importovanej keramiky (terry sigillaty) z mladšej doby rímskej. Nájdený crep terry sigillaty je z prelomu 2. a 3. stor. po Kr. a pochádza z dielní v Rheinzaberne.
Zdroj informacii: http://antonkaiser.blog.sme.sk
http://koncal.blog.sme.sk/c/273116/Jazvinska-jaskyna.html
Podmienky zalogovania cache:

Prilozit k logu fotografiu seba alebo svojho GPS pred vchodom do jaskyne. (dobrovolne)
Poslat mi email cez profil s odpovedami na nasledovne otazky:

Nazov este aspon jednej jaskyne v pohori Tribec.
Preco tu nieje dokonale vyvinuta forma krasu s typickou jaskynnou výzdobou?
Ako sa nazyva utvar po pravej strane pri vchode do Jazvinskej jaskyne, na ktory sa viaze slovenska povest?
Zmerajte a napiste priblizny rozmer utvaru.
Popiste farbu vapenca pri vchode a co si myslite, co ju sposobuje. (vlastnymi slovami)

(Neposielajte to do logu. Taketo logy budu vymazane.)

Odpovede zasielajte cez profil. S logovanim nemusíte cakat na odpoved. Ak bude nieco zle, ozvem sa.
Upozornenie: Vstup do jaskyne bez povolenia je zakázany.

 
Jazvinska cave
The Jazvinska cave called also the Debnarova cave is spread at the Debnarov Stal settlement that is a part of the Mala Lehota municipality. The Jazvinska cave was first mentioned in 1893 by Andrej Kmet, an excellent botanist and archaeologist. It belongs to the best known rift-riverine caves in Kostoliansko-lehotska Karst with vertical cavities with flowing solution waters and modelling subsurface flows. The cave was formed under water factors impact on the rifts in the middle trias limestones which build the covering sequel of the Tribec mountain. It spreads 44m horizontal in the limestone massif and goes on with a narrow rift. Some solution crevices and sinter filling build the cave decoration.
Because of impassibility of the subsurface spaces and because of the bottom sludged by sediment runoffs from its surface, the cave was re-tunneled in 1973, 1974, 1975, 1988 and 1989. Nowadays the Jazvinska cave counts to the most beautiful underground nature beauties of the Tribec mountain chain.

Also a finding of the Ancient Roman pottery (terra sigillata) from the Earlier Roman Era comes from this cave. The found terra sigillata potsherd is dated back to the turn of the 2nd into the 3rd cent. AD and comes from workshops in Rheinzabern.
Source of information: http://antonkaiser.blog.sme.sk
http://koncal.blog.sme.sk/c/273116/Jazvinska-jaskyna.html
To log you need to:

Attach a photo of you or your GPS device in front of the cave entrance to the log. (optional)
Send me an email through my profile with answers to these questions:

Name of at least one cave located in mountains Tribec.
Why not here perfectly developed solution forms with a typical cave decoration?
What is the formation name on the right side of the Jazvinska cave entrance which is bound to a Slovak legend?
Measure and write the approximate dimensions of the formation.
Describe coloration of calcite near cave entrance and what causes it. (in your own words)

(Do not post this in your log. Such a log will be deleted.)

Send your answers via profile. With logging you don't have to wait for a response. If something goes wrong, I'll call.
Warning: Enter to the cave without permission is prohibited.

Title: 2#Découverte de...Listrac-Médoc~Cave et Château
Description:
« Les romains lui ont donné son Nom, les Anglais ont su l’apprécier, le XVIII siècle lui a donné ses lettres de noblesses ... tel est LISTRAC, terre de vignes et d’Art où les hommes ont puisé leurs racines. » Dixit : Alain VIAUT, historien et « fils du Pays »
La période romaine a laissé à Listrac la formation de son nom, issu du bas-latin « lista », « listra », (lisière, bordure, limite) « listra » pourrait correspondre à la situation géographique de Listrac, placé à cheval sur la ligne de partage des eaux, les unes s’écoulant vers l’Est et les autres vers l’Ouest du Médoc. De nos jours, c'est surtout par ses vins que Listrac est connu.
Plus d’info sur Listrac ici
Cette série "Découverte de ... Listrac Médoc" comprend 6 caches plus une cache Bonus. Elle vous fera cheminer par un circuit de 7 km dans le bourg et aux alentours du village de Listrac
Ne manquez pas de relever les indices pour la cache Bonus.
Circuit GPX ici
LISTRAC-MEDOC~De la Cave au Château # :
On trouve plusieurs châteaux sur le territoire de la commune produisant leur propre vin, ainsi qu’une Cave coopérative regroupant la production de nombreux propriétaires. Pour cette cache vous cheminerez de la Cave à l’un de ces châteaux.
Le latin étant souvent associé au vin et à la vigne, pour trouver les coordonnées de la cache, vous devrez , au préalable, découvrir deux sentences, phrases en latin, et recueillir d’autres indications qui se cachent aux deux stages, dans un rayon de 30 mètres.
Stage 1 : Vous êtes devant la Cave Coopérative Grand Listrac qui regroupe la production de 170 hectares de vignes sur les 700 que compte la commune.
– la devise latine de cette Cave Grand Listrac se trouvait autrefois sur le fronton du bâtiment. Elle figure sur les étiquettes de ce vin depuis 1937. Elle fait une allusion au fait que Listrac est le toit du médoc avec une altitude de 43 mètres, et peut être à la qualité du vin.
A - nombre de lettres du 2ème mot de cette sentence latine.
B – nombre de voiles du voilier, qui orne les bouteilles de ce vin.
Stage 2 : Cette étape vous conduit devant le Château Semeillan Mazeau. Il est la propriété d'un allemand qui possède également le vignoble Jander.
C - est le nombre de lettres du 5ème mot de la sentence latine
D - est le nombre de lettres du 1er mot de la sentence en latin (qui se trouve dans un rayon de 30 mètres)
Formule de calcul :
N 45° 04 . (D-1)(B+D)(A-1)'
w 00° 47. (C-2) (B+D) (A+4)'
Vous trouverez la traduction des devises latines dans la cache Bonus


La cache est un tube de 5cm x 3 cm

Title: Dragon Cave
Description:
Dies ist der dritte Cache in einer Porzellan Cache Serie.
Jedermann weiss, dass sich Gossi der Drache, der auch auf dem Wappen der Stadt Gossau zu finden ist, mit seinen Freunden im Buechenwald herumtummelt. Aber weisst du auch, wo er wohnt?
Dieser Cache führt dich zu ihm. Bist du mutig genug, um ihm zu begegnen? Um zu seiner Höhle zu gelangen musst du mehrmals einen Bach ohne Brücken überqueren.
Eine Parkmöglichkeit gibt es bei N 47 25.217 E 009 16.252
Sei mutig und stark!

Weitere Caches in dieser Serie: Spitzmaus /Giftzwerg / Alli mini / Camelus Dromedarius / Zwillinge / Ewigi Liäbi / Uhuu

This is the third cache of its kind of a porcelain cache series.
Everybody knows that Gossi the Dragon, who is also featured on the official flag of the town of Gossau, is playing around in the Buechenwald with his friends. But do you know where he lives?
This cache takes you to him. Are you courageous enough to meet him? To get to his cave you have to cross a little stream without bridges several times.
Parking possible at N 47 25.217 E 009 16.252

Be strong and courageous!

Other Caches of this series: Spitzmaus / Giftzwerg / Alli mini / Camelus Dromedarius / Zwillinge / Ewigi Liäbi / Uhuu

Title: Odvaskõ Cave
Description:
The Odvaskõ Cave is the favorite place of bats for mating, therefore this is protected by the law. There's a high rock above the cave, can be nice to get up there (in the summer when it's not snowy, of course).
Leave the car near N47 17.039, E17 42.602, 245 m, and go up on the footpath called "Boroszlán körút" (naming from a species of flower). At N47 17.347, E17 42.918, 365 m, turn to the right, follow the painted sign on the trunks of the trees (red cave on white background). The cache is in the hollow of an old tree, covered by bark.
After hiding the cache again, walk further to the cave. You can get back to the starting point by walking down the stairs. Enjoy the silence of the place!

Title: [JM #3] Le Cave di Tor Marancia
Description:
Le antiche cave di tufo e pozzolana si trovano all'interno della Tenuta di Tormarancia, oggi inserita nel sistema del Parco Regionale dell'Appia Antica.
Oltre all'importanza storico-archeologica, la Tenuta di Tor Marancia rappresenta, con i suoi ampi orizzonti, un luogo di elevato valore paesaggistico: è infatti uno dei pochissimi lembi esistenti di Agro Romano ormai quasi completamente inglobato nel tessuto urbano della Capitale. Il paesaggio leggermente ondulato (altitudini comprese tra i 15 ed i 50 metri s.l.m.), i pianori sommitali, le scarpate e la presenza di “zone umide” permettono una biodiversità elevatissima in rapporto al luogo: siamo praticamente al centro di Roma, a ridosso di quartieri intensamente abitati!
Le Cave, già esistenti ai tempi dell'Impero, vennero utilizzate soprattutto nel '900 per la grande espansione edilizia della capitale. Lo scenario è spettacolare, e non a caso è stato utilizzato per film western, magari cercando di evitare di inquadrare, sullo sfondo, il tamburo della tomba di Cecilia Metella.
Nel 1992 iniziarono gli scavi archeologici della Villa dei Numisi, che furono però rinterrati in seguito. Il sentiero che vi porterà alla cache passa proprio a pochi metri dal luogo degli scavi ma oggi vedrete solo una collina e tanta vegetazione ha ricoperto quella parte del parco.

Title: Bat Cave
Description:
Von der Costa Rei ist es es nicht weit in dieses Wanderparadies am Monte dei Sette Fratelli. Parken könnt Ihr am Forstamt, von dort könnt ihr auf verschiedenen Wegen zum Cache gelangen. Eine sehr schöne Wanderung findet ihr hier. Sie führt Euch vorbei an den Ruinen eines Klosters, über den Sattel Punte dei Sette Fratelli und zu einer Grotte, in welcher der Cache versteckt ist. In der warmen Jahreszeit startet ihr am besten bei Sonnenaufgang. Nehmt auch genügend Wasser mit.



From Costa Rei it is a short drive to the hiker's paradise at Monte dei Sette Fratelli. Parking is available at the forestry office. There start various trails to the cache. A very nice tour you can find here. This trip will bring you to the old ruins of a monastery, to the mountain saddle Punte dei Sette Fratelli und to the cave, where the cache ist hidden. In summer time start at sunrise, mind to take enough water with you.

Title: Grotte Vilters
Description:
Die private Grotte ist frei zugänglich.
Vom Dorf Vilters geht man entlang durch Häuserreihen bis auf den Hügel Crestis und dort am stattlichen Crestis - Haus vorbei.
Ein gut unterhaltener Wiesen-Weg am Waldrand entlang führt sie zur Grotte.

Möglicher Parkplatz bei:
N 47°01.468
E 009° 27.037

Title: La grotte de hohière
Description:
Dominée par le brome érigé (Bromus erectus), elle renferme plusieurs espèces rares ou protégées tel que l'homme-pendu (Orchis anthropophora). Quelques genévriers (Juniperus communis) sont encore présents dans un fourré en bordure du site. La faune n'a pas encore été inventoriée. Seule la grotte fait l'objet d'un suivi régulier, en tant que gîte d'hivernage pour le grand rhinolophe (Rhinolophus ferrumequinum).
Une mise a blanc a été effectuée récemment et l'endroit est complétement nettoyé.








       SOBARDE                  bemi62                       rapace

Title: Nameless in Changchun
Description:
Somewhere in Changchun, in a park (YuhuaYuan ?), close to Dongminzhu St., north of the “Culture Square”, I placed this Traditional, just in order to increase the number of Caches in this tremendous city.
Enjoy walking, relaxing and observing Chinese people in the park, while practising “Tai Chi” or playing traditional Chinese music (un-plugged!)and make your visit even more attractive by a Cache ! Combine this Cache with GC2R0DF, placed by my friend "fogelfrey".

The park is situated in a walking distance of approx. 15 minutes from the famous “Shangri-la” hotel, respectively not even 10 minutes from “Lin-an” hotel.

The “D-rating” is considering the “muggle-density”, especially in summer time and during the weekend / on public holidays.

Happy hunting,

Ni Hao !

Remark: I visit Changchun continuously 2 or 3 times a year. Maintenance is therefore no problem. However, if you think this caches needs maintenance, please write a note and I will inform my Chinese colleague to check the box.

Title: Krizna Jama
Description:
Every year we spend a lot of time, in discovering Slovenia. Geo caching is a very helpful tool to find many great places there, which you normaly do not find in a tourist guide.
So we decided to add another very special place to the long list of sites to visit. We were surprized that one had placed a cache there yet.

ENG:
THE KRIŽNA JAMA (CAVE)
Križna cave is worldwide known karst cave. Its specialities are
underground lakes with sinter's barriers extremely interesting site of cave
bears' bones and naturally preserved environment for animals.

The length of all passages is over 8 km (6 miles). Air temperature inside the cave is constant through the whole year +8°C. The cave drains away water from the Southern side of Bloke plateau towards Eastern margin of Cerknica field. Križna jama is fourth in the world in number of actual cave animals (44 different species). During winter there are about 400 hibernating bats of 7 different species in the cave. The most frequent are lesser horseshoe bats (Rhinolophus hipposideros). Visitors can see some of interesting sites in the cave in one hour.

To experience secrets of intact underground you should make reservation of the long visit ( 4 hours).

SLO:
unfortunately, my slovenian is very limited. if you are a native speaker, and would like to add a description in slovenian, please contact me via geocaching.com
i will add your description to the listing.

happy caching!!!

Title: Lost Places - Castle & Cave
Description:
Lost Places - Castle & Cave
(de) Es erwarten Dich viele Steine, Düsterkeit und Dunkelheit. Lass Dir beim Erkunden der Stationen Zeit - eine noch leere Fotogalerie wartet schließlich darauf, mit inspirierten Aufnahmen aufgefüllt zu werden :) Ich hoffe, Dir mit diesem Cache einige interessante Momente ermöglichen zu können und wünsche viel Erfolg bei der Suche!
(en) Stones, gloominess and darkness are awaiting you. Take your time for exploring the stages - eventually there is a empty photo gallery here awaiting your inspired art. I hope that I was able to give you some interesting moments and wish you good luck for your search.
Stage 1
Koordinaten: N 46° 43.998 O 14° 32.323

(de) Höhlenburgruine Reinegg - Aufgabe: Notiere die ersten drei Ziffern der gleich bleibenden Zahl.
(en) Castle in a Cave 'Reinegg' - Task: Write down the first three digits of the constant number.
Stage 2
Koordinaten: +46° 45.199', +14° 31.657'

(de) Luftschutzbunker Kettenwerk Brückl 2. Weltkrieg - Aufgabe: Suche den zweiten Eingang.
(en) Air-raid shelter for 'Kettenwerk' (chain manufacturer) in Brückl World War II - Task: Search for the second entrance.
Beachte! Please note!
(de) Bitte Attribute beachten und Taschenlampe nicht vergessen. Das Befahren von Höhlen kann gefährlich sein. Koordinaten markieren Zielgebiet. Keine Spoiler-Bilder hochladen.
(en) Please mind the attributes and don't forget to bring a flashlight. Entering a cave might be dangerous. Coordinates show target area. No Spoiler please.
 
 
(de) Informationen zur Höhlenburgruine Reinegg
Die Koordinaten führen Dich zum einstigen Eingang der Burg Reinegg.
Eine halbe Stunde südöstlich von St. Johann am Brückl [Johannserberg], wo nach der Einmündung des Görtschitzbaches in die größere Gurk sich das Thal längs den südwestlichen Ausläufern der Saualpe gegen die Trixner Schlösser und gegen Völkermarkt zu öffnet, stand einst auf einem hohen und steilen aus dem Schiefergebirge aufragenden Urkalkfelsen am linken Ufer der Gurk die Veste [Burg] Reinek, von welcher nur mehr geringe Mauerreste vorhanden sind. Unterhalb des Burgfelsen liegt zwischen demselben und der brausenden Gurk das Gehöft Reinek [...].
(Zwanziger 1873, S.249)


Zwanziger vermutet, dass die Burg wohl schon im 17. Jahrhundert verfallen und verschollen war.
Bei Kohla finden sich zur Ruine folgende Angaben:
Reinegg (Rainegg)
nördlich der Reinegger Gurkbrücke, südlich von Brückl
Ort Reisdorf, Gemeinde Waisenberg, Gerichtsbezirk, Bezirkshauptmannschaft Völkermarkt.
1973 Grenzänderung [Gemeindestrukturreform Kärnten], Rechtsnachfolger Stadtgemeinde Völkermarkt
Höhlenburg-Ruine, gut erkennbare Befestigung in der Felswand oberhalb der Reinegger Brücke, wahrscheinlich schon in urgeschichtlicher Zeit bewohnt; unterhalb führte die Römerstraße vorbei. Erstmals 1176 als castrum Rinecke genannt;
(Kohla 1973, S. 272f)
castrum Rinecke kann mit 'Eck an der Rein' oder 'an einer flachen Mulde' übersetzt werden, sagt Joachim Eichert vom Landesarchiv Kärtnen der Kleinen Zeitung. Es handelte sich wohl um eine Fluchtburg, die kontinuierlich ausgebaut und baulich verändert wurde:
'Alt,verlassen und längst vergessen'

Um die alten Gemäuer ranken sich zahlreiche Mythen und Legenden, die von heidnischen Frauen und Schatzsuchern berichten:
Die Sage hat von den wenigen Mauertrümmern der alten Veste Besitz ergriffen und läßt weiße, wilde oder hadische Frauen in den Höhlen dieses Urkalkfelsen hausen. Einst erschien, wie alte Leute erzählen, eine solche wilde Frau beim Gutsbesitzer Reinegger am Fuße des Felsen und bat mit flehentlichen Geberden, es möge doch Jemand mitgehen, da, wie es schien, oben Jemand krank sei. Es wagte dies aber Niemand und sie weinte beim Fortgehen bitterlich über die Hartherzigkeit der Menschen.

Ergötzlicher ist eine Schatzgräbergeschichte, die sich in den alten Ruinen abspielte. Es trieben längere Zeit hindurch Schatzgräber oben ihr Wesen, die sich in der Nacht durch Feuer und Rauch verriethen, worauf der Pfleger von Trixen den Berg umstellte, sie abfassen ließ und nach Klagenfurt einlieferte. Sie kehrten aber bald wieder und setzten ihre beschwerliche Arbeit, zu deren glücklicher Vollendung sie eine Messe lesen ließen, nun öffentlich fort. Ihre Mühe und Ausdauer wurde belohnt, denn sie hoben endlich den schweren Schatz aus beträchtlicher Tiefe in Gestalt eines Mühlsteines, unter dem zwei menschliche Vorderarmknochen kreuzweise lagen. Auch der Stein wurde auseinander geschlagen, ob er nicht in seinem Innern noch Schätze berge; es fand sich aber nichts vor, als eben Steintrümmer und so zogen denn die beutelustigen Schatzgräber enttäuscht wieder ihres Weges fürbaß.
(Zwanziger 1873, S.252)
Eine weitere Sage zur Höhlenburg befasst sich ebenfalls mit den geheimnisvollen Frauen von Reinegg, deren Seelen noch immer umherwandern und auf Erlösung warten. Zu den weißen, wilden Frauen gibt es einen aufschlussreichen Wikipedia-Eintrag: 'Salige Frau'
Die Sage wird von Georg Graber erzählt: 'Die Saligen Frauen von Reinegg'


* Kohla, Franz Xaver / Metnitz, Gustaf Adolf von / Moro, Gotbert (1973): Kärntner Burgenkunde. Ergebnisse und Hinweise in Übersicht. Erster Teil. Kärntens Burgen, Schlösser, Ansitze und wehrhafte Stätten. Ein Beitrag zur Siedlungstopographie. In: Moro, Gotbert (Hrsg.): Aus Forschung und Kunst, (17), S.272f.

* Zwanziger, Gustav Adolf (1873): Mittheilungen aus dem Görtschitzthale. In: Carinthia. Zeitschrift für Vaterlandskunde, Belehrung und Unterhaltung, 63, S.249-252.

Title: Grotta dello Smeraldo
Description:
Grotta dello Smeraldo




The Grotta dello Smerlado (Italian for "Emerald Cave") is a sea cave. It´s located in the comune Conca dei Marini in the province of Salerno, Campania on the Amalfi Coast. The Amalfi Coast is one of the most famous and beautiful stretchs of coastline in Italy.


It is one of several sea caves, worldwide, that is flooded with a brilliant blue or emerald light. The quality and nature of the color in each cave is determined by the unique lighting conditions in that particular cave. The grotto, which is located along the Amalfi Coast, is partly filled with water. The surface area of the water measures roughly 45 x 32 meters.
Unlike the more famous Blue Grotto a few miles to the west on Capri (there is another Earthcache), the Grotta dello Smeraldo has no natural outlet above the waterline. The only opening to the outside world is just below the water level. Refracted sunlight entering the cavern through the opening gives the water its characteristic emerald glow during daylight hours.


The absence of a natural opening above the waterline meant that the grotto’s existence remained unknown for many years, so the cave was discovered by a fisherman named Luigi Buoncore in 1932 who took a look through a hole on the rock.

GEOLOGY

The cliff was formed through erosion. The Amalficoast exists of limestone, so the sea eroded the cliff because of the continuous waves, which are bouncing through the stone. In the beginning of the Emerald Cave,it wasn´t in the sea, it was above the former sea level. During this age stalactites and stalagmites took shape. Then the sea level rised, so the cave slowly was partially flooted up by the sea. Today the former entrance is a tunnel under the water, where the light comes into the cave and named it „Emerald Cave“ because of the color of the water.


The grotto is accessible from Strada Statale 163, the main road along the Amalfi Coast. In front of the entrance to the cave there is a parking area for parking your cachemobile. Then you´ve to walk through the gate to elevators, which are bringing you to the sea level. You can reach to the "Grotta dello Smeraldo" also by boat; infact from the Amalfi's harbour many boats go to and for the cave, each hour.

If you want to take a look inside, you have to pay for it. But then a guide let you sit down on a boat and rows you through the cave. Then you can see the emerald light. Unfortunately, the guide just speaks english, and so he sits quiet in the boat and doesn´t talk with you. But another guide sings in the cave, so that it sounds right good in it.

To log this EarthCache, please email me, Max_K., the answers to the following questions using the profile link above. (Please write in german or english, I´m not able to talk italian):

1.How high is the cavern roof above the sea level?
2.Estimate the high of the entrance, through which you would walk, if you take a look inside the cave!(You don´t have to go inside, but using the elevator doesn´t cost anything.)
3.When is the best time to visit the Grotta dello Smeraldo, because the light can be seen very well?
4.How long is the underwater-tunnel?

Optional conditions:
Please post a picture of you and/or your GPS near the area in front of the cave-entrance, but watch out not to show the entrance on your pic! A pic of the cave inside would be nice, too.

Have fun!




Die Grotta dello Smerlado( italienisch für „Smaragdgrotte“) ist eine Seegrotte in der Kommune Conca dei Marini in der Provinz Salerno, Campania an der Amalfiküste. Diese ist eine der schönsten und bekanntesten Küstenabschnitte in Italien.

Die Grotte ist eine von den Seehöhlen weltweit, die mit einem wunderschönen strahlend blauen oder smaragdgrünen Licht durchflutet wird. Die Qualität und Intensität der Farbe wird durch die einzigartige Lichtverhältnisse in der jeweiligen Höhle bestimmt. Die Grotte ist teilweise mit Wasser gefüllt; die Oberfläche des Wassers misst rund 45 x 32 Meter.
Im Gegensatz zur berühmten Blauen Grotte auf Capri hat die Grotta dello Smeraldo keine natürliche Öffnung oberhalb der Wasserlinie. Während der Tagesstunden gibt das Licht, was durch eine Öffnung unter Wasser hereinströmt, dem Wasser sein smaragdgrünes Leuchten. Aufgrund, dass es nur eine Öffnung unter Wasser gab, hieß natürlich, dass die Höhle lange unentdeckt blieb, so wurde die Höhle erst 1932 von einem Fischer namens Luigi Buoncore , welcher durch ein Loch im Felsen guckte, entdeckt.
GEOLOGIE

Die ganze Amalfiküste wurde durch Erosion erschaffen. Die Küste besteht aus Kalkstein, welche durch die kontinuierlichen Wellen des Meeres, welche gegen die Küste schlagen, erodiert. Am Anfang der Geschichte der Smaragdgrotte, war diese über Wasser, sodass Stalaktiten und Stalagmiten Gestalt annahmen. Dann aber stieg der Meeresspiegel, sodass die Höhle allmählich überflutet wurde. Heute ist der ehemalige Eingang unter Wasser. Dort kommt das Licht hindurch, welches der Grotte ihren Namen gab.


Die Grotte ist über die Strada Statale 163, der Hauptstraße entlang der Amalfiküste, zu erreichen. Vor dem Eingangsschild ist auch ein Parkplatz, wo ihr euer Auto abstellen könnt. Dann müsst ihr durch den kleinen Torbogen gehen und mit den Fahrstühlen auf Meeresniveau fahren. Von dort aus ist es nur noch ein paar Schritt zum Eingang der Höhle. Ihr könnt aber auch von Amalfi aus auf ein Boot umsatteln, und euch zur Grotte schippern lassen.

Wenn ihr euch die Grotte angucken wollt, müsst ihr jedoch dafür bezahlen. Wenn ihr dies tut, werdet ihr mit einem Boot durch die Höhle gerudert, und könnt das Schimmern des Lichts hautnah erleben. Leider kann der Guide bloß italienisch (wenn ich das richtig erfasst habe) sprechen, sodass er nur stumm euch rumrudert. Ein anderer singt aber auch mal, und erzählt etwas über die Stalagmiten und Stalaktiten.

Um diesen Earthcache loggen zu dürfen, beantworte bitte folgende Fragen in einer Mail an mich (Max_K.):

1.Wie hoch ist die Höhle über dem Meeresspiegel?
2. Schätze die Höhe des Eingang, durch welchen du gehen würdest, wenn du die Höhle anschauen willst!(Ihr müsst nicht in die Höhle hinein, sondern sollt bloß von außen gucken, und das Benutzen des Fahrstuhles ist nicht verbindlich oder kostenpflichtig!)
3. Wann kann man das Licht am besten sehen (Tageszeit) , nicht nur weil die ganzen anderen Touristen da Essen sind ?
4. Wie lang ist der Unterwassertunnel, durch welchen das Licht fällt?



Optional: Mache bitte ein Foto von dir und/oder deinem GPS auf der Ebene vor dem Eingang der Höhle. Achte aber darauf den Höhleneingang nicht auf dem Bild zu haben! Ein Bild von der Höhle innendrin würde auch nett sein.

Viel Spaß!



In Costiera Amalfitana, a 5 Km da Amalfi, nell’incantevole baia di Conca dei Marini, si trova la Grotta dello Smeraldo. Scoperta nel 1932 da un pescatore locale, la Grotta dello Smeraldo di Conca de' Marini deve il suo nome alla particolare colorazione assunta dall'acqua che riflette la luce che filtra dalle rocce di quel tratto di Costiera Amalfitana, creando effetti cromatici dalle strabilianti sfumature: dal blu cobalto, al turchese al verde smeraldo.
La Grotta dello Smeraldo, che nell'antichità non era invasa dall'acqua, è larga circa 30 metri per 60 e alta 24 metri nei punti più alti, ed è ricca di colonne, stalattiti e stalagmiti dalle forme bizzarre,che creano un ambiente incantato, tappa obbligata per i turisti che visitano ogni anno la magnifica Costiera Amalfitana.
L'ingresso della Grotta dello Smeraldo è raggiungibile dalla SS 163, la suggestiva strada panoramica che va da Salerno fino a Positano. Successivamente, mediante l'ascensore o l'apposita scala, si raggiunge l'interno della cavità naturale.
Da tutte le principali località della Costiera Amalfitana e Sorrentina ci sono poi traghetti che organizzano escursioni guidate, oltre la possibilità di affittare zattere, condotte da marinai, che guidano il turista in questa breve (l'escursione dura circa 30 minuti), ma affascinante avventura. Nelle sue acque è possibile altresì ammirare un affascinante e originale presepe subacqueo, in ceramica di Vietri sul Mare, posto sul fondo della grotta dello Smeraldo a circa 4 metri di profondità. Ogni anno, nel periodo natalizio, dei sub si immergono nelle acque cristalline della Costiera Amalfitana, e adagiano il bambino Gesù sul fondale della grotta.
Dal 2005 poi, su iniziativa dell'Azienda di Soggiorno e Turismo di Amalfi, si organizza, nel periodo estivo, per incrementare e diversificare l'offerta turistica della Costiera Amalfitana, una originale kermesse intitolata "Le magie alla Grotta dello Smeraldo": una straordinaria miscellanea di eventi, dalla musica, al teatro al cabaret, che si alternano sul piazzale antistante la la Grotta trasformato per l’occasione in una vera e propria piazza sullo splendido mare della Costiera Amalfitana.
Il tutto condito dalla degustazioni dei prodotti tipici della Costiera, tra tutti le sfogliatelle Santa Rosa inventate alcuni secoli fa dalle suore dell’omonimo convento di Conca dei Marini.
 GEOLOGIA
 "Grotta dello Smeraldo" ha karst tipico ed elementi di caverne marini. All'inizio la caverna fu al di sopra del mare e, durante quest'età, le stalattiti e le stalagmiti presero la forma. Lentamente, quando il livello del mare rised sulla costa, la caverna fu parzialmente flooted su dal mare. Oggi, la caverna è collegata al mare attraverso un tunnel 12 mts a lungo e a 4 mts in profondità.
 

Per loggare questa Earthcache, per favore dovete inviare una e-mail a me, Max_K., le risposte alle seguenti domande usando il link al profilo di cui sopra. (Per favore scrivete in Tedesco o in Inglese, non parlo Italiano):

1.Quanto è alto il soffitto della caverna sul livello del mare?
2.Stimate l'altezza dell'entrata, attraverso la quale dovrete passare se volete dare un'occhiata all'interno della grotta (Non dovete entrare dentro, ma usando l'ascensore, non costa niente).
3.Quando è il periodo di tempo migliore per visitare la Grotta dello Smeraldo, affinché si possa vedere meglio la luce?
4.Quanto è lungo il tunnel sottomarino?


Condizioni opzionali:
Opzionalmente pubblicate per favore una foto di voi e/o il vostro GPS vicino all'area di fronte all'entrata della grotta, ma badate di non mostrare l'entrata nella vostra foto! Anche una vostra foto all'interno della grotta sarebbe carina!

Title: On the Bridge!
Description:
Über der Umgehungsstraße,kurz vor den Mauern unserer Stadt
versteckte ich einen Geocache, wie ihn noch keiner gesehen hat
er hat kaum Fassungsvermögen, wirklich kein Quatsch,
geh'n dir die Nerven durch wirst du noch verrückter gemacht.

Hey hey hey, ich bin der kleine Cache
hey hey hey, ich bin ein Cache dieser Stadt
hey hey hey, ich war so schön durchdacht
und nun wurd ich ausgelegt damit ich euch freude mach!

Ich dachte mir ich Texte ein wenig den Goldenen Reiter von Joachim Witt um.

P.S. Es ist nicht nötig sich in Gefahr zu begeben,noch irgendwo gefährlich zu parken,es sind genug Parkmöglichkeiten vor Ort vorhanden.Bitte geht sorgsam mit meinem ersten Cache um sodass auch noch andere Cacher ihre Freude daran haben werden.

Vielen Dank sagt Chris.Mine

Title: Grotte de grobois
Description:
Origine : En 1870, Joseph Mélotte s'installa à Grosbois. C'était un fermier, mais, Grosbois étant à l'époque un but de promenade, il ouvrit un débit de boissons et installa un jeu de quilles. C'est alors que son épouse tomba gravement malade, atteinte d'une pneumonie. Vénérant la Vierge, Joseph Mélotte lui promet de lui construire un sanctuaire si son épouse guérit. Son voeu fut exaucé.

Tout savoir : Avec ses sept fils, Joseph Mélotte amasse les pierres dans les fagnes de Fagnoulx, de Baugnez, de Chivremont. Le 12 octobre 1912, il pose la première pierre. La construction va durer deux ans. En 1914, la grotte est terminée et une statue de N-D de Lourdes en provenance de Liège y est installée. En ces temps de guerre, la grotte devient un lieu de pèlerinage. Vers la fin de la guerre, le représentant de la Prusse voulut faire enlever cette vierge d'origine "wallonne». Mais la fermeté de Joseph Mélotte l'emporta. Lors de l'offensive des Ardennes, Grosbois, pris entre les deux fronts, fut pratiquement anéanti. La grotte resta inébranlablement intacte. Elle est encore aujourd'hui l'objet de pèlerinage des villages de Waimes et Thirimont.

Title: Grotta all'onda
Description:
[IT] Grotta all’Onda si trova a circa 700 metri di altezza, alle pendici del Monte Matanna. La grotta, lunga e stretta, si trova alla base di un’ampia parete rocciosa, dalla cui sommità scendono rivoli e cascatelle d’acqua che rendono il posto davvero suggestivo. La caverna è attualmente oggetto di studio poiché sono stati ritrovati al suo interno reperti preistorici tra cui anche ossa umane. Il luogo è suggestivo, oltre che per il paesaggio, anche per l’acustica; in alcuni punti è nitidissimo il fenomeno dell’eco. Inoltre, in occasione di inverni particolarmente rigidi, alcune cascatelle gelano e l’acqua nebulizzata che si posa su erba ed alberi si trasforma in uno strato vetrato, rendendo l’atmosfera veramente incantata. Oltre alla grotta principale ve ne sono anche altre più piccole, lungo la parete sulla quale sono presenti anche alcuni brevi percorsi attrezzati per l’arrampicata sportiva.
Per raggiungere Grotta all’Onda si parte da Trescolli, frazione di Casoli. Si prosegue oltre il paese fino ad incontrare un divieto di accesso. Parcheggiare qui e proseguire a piedi (ma è possibile anche lasciare l’auto più avanti, oltre al divieto, in una delle numerose piazzole presenti ai lati della strada). Poco prima di una sbarra, all’altezza di una piazzola, si imbocca a destra un viottolino in leggera salita (evitare quello pianeggiante che entra nel bosco) che, in prossimità del tornante stradale, incrocia il tracciato dell’acquedotto costituito da piastre in cemento. Seguire ora l’acquedotto verso destra, praticamente in piano, superando anche un ponticello metallico. Più oltre si incontra un passaggio caratteristico, in cui la sporgenza della roccia crea una specie di tunnel (vedi foto) aggirabile su passerella metallica. Attenzione a prendere la deviazione a sinistra appena superato questo tratto. Il sentiero prosegue ora in salita superando due vasche abbeveratoio in cemento: qui è possibile riempire la borraccia. Il sentiero ben marcato conduce infine alla meta, da quando si è lasciata l’auto è trascorsa almeno un’ora.
Essendo il luogo abbastanza frequentato, la cache è stata posizionata poco oltre le cascatelle, ad una quindicina di metri circa dalle rocce in direzione di una radura con segni di bivacco.
La cache è un contenitore di plastica che contiene:
logbook e penna; certificato FTF; GC; Winny-the-pooh; squalo.

[EN] Grotta all’Onda is located about 700 meters high at the foot of Mount Matanna. The cave, long and narrow, is placed at the base of a large rock, from the top of which fall down streams and waterfalls that make the place really beautiful. The cave is currently being studied because prehistoric remains, including human bones, have been found inside. The place is charming for the landscape, as well as for the acoustics; in some points there is a clear echo phenomenon. Additionally, during very cold winters, some small waterfalls freeze and water mist that settles on the grass and trees is transformed into a layer of glass, making the atmosphere truly enchanted. Besides the main cave, there are other smaller ones, along the wall on which there are also some short clinbing routes.
To reach Grotta all'Onda you have to go to Trescolli, a village of Casoli. Go on after the village till you meet a denial of access. Park here and go on walking, (but you can also leave the car ahead, after the prohibition, on one of the many places on the sides of the road). Just before a bar, at the right of a square, take a track uphill (avoid the plain track leading into the woods) that, near a sharp turn, crosses the path of the aqueduct made of concrete plates. Now follow the aqueduct to the right, practically flat, passing a metal bridge. More over, there is a characteristic passage, where the ledge of the rock creates a sort of tunnel (see picture), circumvented by a metal walkway. Be careful to take the left fork just after this stretch. The trail continues now uphill past two drinking concrete tanks: here you can fill the bottle. The well-marked path eventually leads to the goal, since you parked the car it’s about an hour.
Since the place is frequented enough, the cache was located just beyond the waterfall, about fifteen meters from the rocks, in the direction of a clearing with signs of bivouac.
The cache is a plastic bag that contains:
Logbook, pen, FTF certificate, GC, Winny-the-pooh, little shark

Title: Jama Zijalka / Zijalka Cave
Description:
SLO: Obmocje Begunj je bogato z arheološkimi najdbami. Do njih pelje urejena Lambergova pot, imenovana po vitezu Gašperju Lambergu, ki je živel na gradu Kamen. Obiskovalca vodi pot od gradu Kamen iz 12. stoletja, jame Zijalke iz casa mlajše kamene dobe, Hudicevega gradica prvic omenjen leta 1185 in arheoloških najdbišc Njivice s sledovi iz starejše bronaste dobe do starejše železne dobe.. Vec izveste na kraju samem iz informativnih tabel v treh jezikih. Dostop do Hudicevega gradica je neurejen in zahteven. Brez ustreznega plezalnega znanja in opreme obisk odsvetujemo.

ENG: Begunje area is rich in archaeological finds. Regulated Lamberg route leads to them. Route is named after the knight Gašper Lamberg, who has lived in Castle Rock. Visitor trail leads from the Castle Rock (from the 12 century), the Cave Zijalka (from Neolithic time), the Devil's small chateau (first mentioned in 1185) and archaeological sites Njivice (traces of older Bronze Age to the Iron Age) . Find out more on the spot from the information boards in three languages. Access to the Devil's small chateau is messy and difficult. Without proper climbing skills and equipment isn’t advised to visit.

Title: Jaskyna&bifurkacia / Cave&Bifurcation on Branisko
Description:
Pre zalogovanie tejto earthcache, zasli prosim odpovede na následujúce otázky:
1. Na strane ponoru najdeš betonové pozostatky hrádze hydrologického merného profilu. Odhadni ich výšku.

2. Na strane výveru sa nachádza mostik – z akého materiálu je vytvorený?

3. Aká je vzdušná vzdialenost medzi miestami, kde sa vlievaju do Hornadu jednotlivé prudy po bifurkacii.

4. Dobrovolné: pridaj svoju fotku na strane ponoru alebo výveru v pozadí.

To log this cearthache, please send me answers on this questins:
1. In the area of dive-cave you will find the remains of the concrete dam of hydrological measuring profile. Estimate their height.

2. In the area of outflow-cave there is a bridge - what material is the bridge made of?

3. What is the direct distance between the points where individual streams flow into river Hornad after bifurcation.

4. Voluntary: post a photo of you and/or your GPS in your log. Take picture in front dive-cave or outflow-cave.




Jaskyna Diablova diera

V strednej casti Braniska, 300 m pod sútokom Velkej Svinky a Dolného potoka a 500 m nad sedlom Branisko, v nadmorskej výške 748 m sa vdaka mechanickej erózii vyvinul pozoruhodný krasový fenomén – sústava ponornej a výverovej jaskyne Diablova diera. Výver nazývaný Bystrík je na druhej strane hrebena vo výške 720 m. Vchod do jaskyne predstavuje výrazný previs a nachádza sa asi 20 m od vybudovanej hrádze hydrologického merného profilu. Previsový vchod je malých rozmerov a prechádza dvomi prudkými a úzkymi perejami. Za perejami vedie oblúková chodba asi 120 m. Chodba je spociatku 10 m široká, je nízka a mierne klesá. Neskôr sa rozširuje, prudšie klesá a vytvára pomerne velkú sálu. Na konci potok mizne v sifóne. V sále sú pozoruhodné štrkovo-pieskové náplavy, ktoré neustále menia rozmery a tvar, a to v priamej súvislosti s castými prívalovými daždami posledných rokov. Vody sa neskôr objavujú na druhej strane hrebena vo vyvierackách. Hlavná vyvieracka je pomerne nízka a úzka. Vody vytekajúce z vyvieracky vytvárajú Diablov potok. Severne nad hlavným výverom sa nachádza jeden menší a jeden úplne malý výver.

Bifurkacia Velkej svinky

V priestore pred Diablovou dierou dochádza k bifurgácii Velkej Svinky. Znamená to, že cast vôd odbocuje na západ, aby sa stratila v markantnom ponore a cast vôd pokracuje svojím korytom južným a neskôr juhovýchodným smerom. V tomto prípade lavá vetva (z pohladu nad rozdvojením) ako potok a neskôr riecka Svinka tecie z nášho údolia popod sedlo Branisko, odvodnuje východnú cast jeho svahov, potom sa stáca, kluckuje Šarišskou vrchovinou, Ciernou horou a následne sa vlieva do Hornádu. Pravá vetva sa po pár metroch stráca v ponore Diablovej diery a tecie krížom cez hreben pohoria v dolomitovom podloží. Na západnej strane vyviera v niekolkých miestach, steká ako potok Diablov potok do Polanoviec, tu sa vlieva do potoka Branisko, ktorý sa po sútoku so Žehricou a Margeciankou vlieva do Hornádu. Voda z jedného pramena sa teda dostane do tejto rieky dvomi cestami, paradoxné je, že "odklonená" cast vody z Diablovej diery ovela skôr, než hlavný tok Velkej Svinky.
K bifurkacii dochadza, ked vodny tok, ktory tecie v jednom prude sa rozdeli do dvoch alebo viacerych samostatnych prudov, ktore pokracuju samostatne. Niektoré rieky tvoria komplex sietí jednotlivých prúdov, a to najmä v deltách. Ak sa prudy nakoniec opat zlucia, potom bifurkacia vytvori ostrov.





Cave Devil's hole

In the middle of a mountain Branisko, 300 m below the confluence of the creek Velka Svinka („Great Piggies“) and Dolny potok („Lower Creek“) and 500 m above the saddleback Branisko, at an altitude of 748 m is due to mechanical erosion of the karst has developed a remarkable phenomenon - a system of dive-cave and outflow-cave Diablova diera („Devil's Hole“). Outflow called Bystrík is on the other side of the ridge at an altitude of 720m. The entrance is a significant overhang and is located about 20 m from the dam which was constructed as hydrological measuring profile. Overhang entrance is small size and passes through two narrow and steep rapids. Behind the rapids there is arc corridor of about 120 m. Corridor is initially 10 m wide, is low and slightly declining. Later extended, sharply falls and creates a relatively large room. At the end the stream disappears in the siphon. In the hall there is remarkable pebble-sand sediments, which are constantly changing size and shape, depending on frequent torrential rains last years. Water is then appearing on the other side of the ridge in a few outflows. Main outflow is relatively low and narrow and creates new creek Diablov potok („Devil's Creek“). North of the main outflow is a smaller and a little outflow.

Bifurcation of creek Velka svinka
 In the area of Devil's Hole there is bifurcation of creek Velka Svinka. This means that part of the water turns to the west and disappears in the striking dive and part of water continues south and then south-easterly direction. In this case the left stream (from the viewpoint of the bifurcation) is flowing as river Svinka from saddleback Branisko, drains the eastern part of the slope, then flows trough Saris highlands, mountain chain Cierna hora and flows into the river Hornad. Right stream is losing in the cave Diablova diera after a few meters and flows across the mountain ridge in the dolomite bedrock. On the west side of mountain the springs in several places, as the Diablov potok flows down to village Polanovce, here it flows into a creek Branisko, which is the confluence with Zehrica and Margecianka. Eventually water is flows into the river Hornad. Water from a single stream thus gets into the same river in two ways, a paradox is that "deviated" part of the water from the Diablova diera reaches river Hornad much sooner than the main stream of Svinka.
River bifurcation occurs when a river flowing in a single stream separates into two or more separate streams which continue downstream. Some rivers form complex networks of distributaries, especially in their deltas. If the streams eventually merge again, then the bifurcation forms an island.

Title: Turska jama II. / Turkish Cave II.
Description:
SLO: »Turška jama«, ki jo omenja že J.V. Valvasor, se nahaja pod vrhom hriba Gojzdašnica (864m/nv), na njegovi severozahodni strani. Gre za težje dostopno, vecjo skalno votlino, ki je naravno zavarovana. Ima dvodelno odprtino, zaprto s kamnitim zidom. Zgornja vecja odprtina je bila nekoc zaprta z železnimi kovanimi duri. Utrdba je nastala v casu 15. – 16. stoletja in je služila kot varno zatocišce predvsem za otroke, ženske in starce v casu turških vpadov. Vrnimo se v sedanjost in se povzpnimo še na skalni pomol nad jamo. Od tu si lahko privošcimo pogled na levi breg Save, kjer prehaja Dolina v Deželo in naprej prav do ocaka Triglava. Za dostop do jame, predvsem zaradi zadnjega kratkega, a strmega vzpona priporocam suho vreme. Na družinskem izletu je primerno otroke zavarovati pred zdrsom.

ENG: "Turkish Cave", which already mentioned J.V. Valvasor, is located near the top of the hill Gojzdašnica (864m/nv), on its north side. , Larger rock cavity, which is naturally hedged is difficult to access. It has a two-part opening closed by a stone wall. The upper opening is bigger and was once closed with the door of forged iron. The fort was built in the 15th - 16 century and has served primarily as a safe place for children, women and old men at the time of Turkish invasions. Let us return to the present and climb the rocky pier over the cave. From here you can have a look at the left bank of the Sava River, which crosses the valley in the land and continue right up to the mountain of Triglav. To access the cave, mainly due to last a short but steep ascent recommend dry weather. On a family trip, it is appropriate to protect children from slipping.
