Title: Snezna jama
Description:
Koordinate vas bodo pripeljale do vhoda v jamo. Zaklad je skrit cisto na koncu jame - dobrih 5 minut v notranjost. Za obisk je potrebna svetilka. Sigurno pa boste tudi umazani. Do zaklada se pozimi verjetno ne bo dalo priti - odvisno od kolicine snega - saj vcasih sneg zasuje dostop v jamo, od tod tudi ime. Dostop v jamo je strm in drsec, zato previdnost ne bo odvec. Na poti do zaklada boste naleteli na dve "naravni pregradi", kjer utegnete visokorasli iskalci imeti manjše težave. Za obisk zaklada nujno potrebujete svetilko, dobre cevlje in oblacila, ki se lahko umažejo.
[ENG] Coordinates will lead you to the entrance of the cave. Treasure is hidden in the very end of the cave - 5 minutes inside. To visit the cache flashlight is needed. Sure, you'll also dirty. In the the winter may not be possible to get the cache - depending on the amount of snow - snow sometimes swamped access to the cave. Access to the cave is steep and slippery, so caution may be necessary. On the way to the treasure you will encounter two "natural barrier", where tall persons may have some minor problems. To visit the cache you need flashlight, good shoes and clothes that can get dirty.

Title: Flint Mountain Cave
Description:
The village of Szentgál

This place has been habited since the stone age, because of its secure location in the mountain. Legend has it that it is named after a priest from Saint Gallen. He traveled the land on the orders of Duke Géza to convert the Hungarian population to Christianity. The village is first mentioned in a document dating back to 1281. The residents were thu hunters of the King.

Flint Mountain Cave

The cave is located about 650 yards West-Northwest of the village of Szentgál. Its two entrances are found in an abandoned part of the quarry. These entrances are being slowly filled up with the fallen stones. The Southern gate is about 1.5yards by 1.5 yards. The 2-yard wide Northern entrance is low and it can be accessed by sliding through it. The entrances are at about 400 yards elevation level.
The cave is about 90 yards long in total. The largest hollow is about 210 sqm.
Fourteen protected bats species inhabit the cave. They also use it as a temporary shelter. This is the only proven place of occurrence of the Northern bat in the country.

The entrance to the cave is blocked by metal bars due to the falling rocks inside. And the bats should not be disturbed either.
Building fire in front of the cave is prohibited.

The cache

N 47° 8,2590' E 17° 41,9690' 408 m.
There is a white capsule under a moss cover rock near the lower right corner of the entrance.
Please, hide the capsule carefully after finding it.

The village can be reached on Road 8 from Veszprém. Turn south at Herend.
You can park at the railway station: N 47° 8,1760' E 17° 42,4630' 385 m
You should walk from here towards the cave. After finding the cache, you can take the red marked path back to your car.
The total distance is about 1.3 miles. Elevation difference: 67 yards.

(Translation:ID=12082 Thank you!)

Title: Grotta La Palombara
Description:
Italiano descrizone:

Grotta La Palombara

Le Coste delle Puglia sono 80% Calcarea e pietra Dolomia.
Insieme formano una combiazione ripida e di calce molte dura come la roccia dolomitiea.
si ceome la roccia dolmitiea a molto dura (durissima) quindi non sono portate a erusioni.



La grotta la Palombara e al livello del mare essa e ststa portata su da una eruzione.
Lo scoglio dolomitico e stato sollevato dalle acque milioni di anni fa cosi ha piu entrate.



Il dentro delle grotte e tipico del calcare delle Puglia le demensioni della grotte all interno sono enormi.
L incresso delle grotte sono visibile dalla terra e si entra tramite una Barca
La bellezza di queste grotte e L enorma profendita interna.

 




Diario di bordo:

Calcolare L altzza argezza della grotte una Lampada visitare queste grotte abbiamo bisogno di.
Una corda x la profondita l elometro che molte barche l anno eotie Equipagiameto
Quarda la struttura delle grotta quandro entri e poi


Scrivere un messaggio sul mio profilo.



 English describtion:

The coast of Apulia consists of limestone and dolomite. The percentage proportion of these rock types is 80%.
The combination of both types is very interesting.
Strong eroded limestone is surrounded by dolomite.
Dolomite is a very tough type of rock and the
erosion has only a little effect on dolomite.



The cave is located at sea level and so it is exposed to erosion.



The limestone was washed and formed out the dolomite cliffs and there build a small entrance to the cave.
Inside the cave you will see a changing of the composition of the typical italian minerals.
The erosion inside the cave is gigantic.

 





You can see the entrance to the cave only from the sea and you can reach it only with boat.

The size of the cave is an absolute specificity, unique and an exceptional item.

To log this Earthcache:


Measure the depth of the water. Use for this a cord or a sounder.
Estimate the height and width of the cave.
Use a flashlight for this.
Please compare and describe the rock at the entrance and inside the cave.


Please send me this description with email together via Contact from Profil, with the results of your measure.

Title: Tanzstunde
Description:
Nach dem Tanzen hatten wir noch Zeit bis der Bus fuhr. So kamen wir auf einmal auf die Idee, an unsrem schönen Platz die Leiten hinter uns hochzuklettern, die Luke zu öffnen und mal den Fluss unter uns zu wissen.
Heute wo wir Cacher sind haben wir uns gedacht, dass dort auf jedenfall ein Cache hin muss.

Die Dose ist bei Tag und bei Nacht gut zu erreichen. Ich empfehle euch allerdings ihn in der Nacht zu machen, weil die Muggel am Tag sehr aktiv sind.

Viel Spaß beim Suchen und Finden.

Title: Grotta del Leone
Description:
--- ITALIANO ---
La Grotta del Leone si trova lungo la strada che costeggia il Monte Pisano tra Asciano ed Agnano; sul lato est il pavimento scende fino a raggiungere il livello delle acque di un piccolo laghetto sotterraneo. Al centro della stanza si trova un enorme masso la cui forma, somigliante ad un leone, ha suggerito il nome dato alla Grotta. Sul lato nord un’apertura conduce ad una seconda camera interna, raggiungibile anche salendo dal lato ovest e calandosi per un piccolo passaggio.

Fu scavata negli anni ’50 da E. Tongiorgi. Vi furono rinvenuti resti di industrie litiche del Paleolitico superiore ma più importante è la frequentazione durante il Neolitico con importanti testimonianze di culti: in particolare furono identificati culti agrari, attestati da un focolare con grano e da circoli di pietre con ossa umane. Forse vi furono anche culti delle acque, collegabili alla presenza del laghetto. Vennero rinvenuti anche resti di sepolture dell’età del Rame con armi in metallo e selce e ornamenti su osso e conchiglia.

La Grotta è facilmente accessibile: lasciate l’auto poco dopo il cimitero, o subito dopo la curva (vedi mappa) e proseguite fino al waypoint1, qui entrate nel sottobosco e dirigetevi verso il palo della luce visibile nella foto 4. L’ingresso della grotta è proprio davanti a voi. La cache è un contenitore lock’n’lock; è nascosta all’esterno della grotta, noi naturalmente consigliamo di portare una torcia ed entrare a visitarla, si può fare in tutta sicurezza e senza sporcarsi.

Contenuto originale della cache:
- Logbook e penna
- Certificato FTF
- Bustine figurine
- Geocoin
- Conchiglia
- Pallina di gomma
- Pallina per gatti


--- ENGLISH ---
The Lion Cave is situated on the road that skirts the Pisan Mountain between Asciano and Agnano; the floor comes down on the east side until it reaches the level of a little underground lake. In the middle of the cave there is a big rock, which looks like a lion, that's the reason why the cave got its particular name. On the north side there is an entrance to a second chamber, that can be reached to a second way (going upstairs to the west side and down in a little passage).

In the cave there was found rests of Paleolithic and Neolithic, like circles of stones with human bones, and rests of the Copper era (metal and stone weapons, and ornaments made by bones and shells).

The cave can be easily reached: you can park the car after the cemetery, or immediately after the turn of the street (see map), walk to waypoint1 and then enter in the bushes. You can see a light pole (see photo 4), the entrance of the cave is just after it. The cache is a lock’n’loch container; it is hidden outside the cave, but for us the best thing is to bring a torch and enter to visit, you can make it without problems.
Original contents of the cache:

- Logbook and pen
- FTF Certificate
- Geocoin
- Shell
- Pallina di gomma
- Little gum ball
- Ball for cats

Title: Dul Engerth / Engerth mine
Description:
POPIS

 Stav težní budovy z roku 2011. Situation mining building from 2011.

[CZ]
Uhelný dul založený Spolecností státní dráhy pod oznacením “Nr. V” patril k nejvýznamnejším kladenským dolum. Jméno dostal po prvním generálním rediteli Spolecnosti státní dráhy Wilhelmu Engrthovi významnému profesoru Vysoké technické školy ve Štýrském Hradci.
Jáma byla zaražena v r.1868 v obdélníkovém profilu 6,635x2,22m se tremi oddíly – jižní vetrací, strední težní a severní lezné a vodotežné oddelení. V hloubce 386m byla odkryta uhelná sloj o mocnosti 9,48m. První patro bylo zaraženo v hloubce 390,58m a pozdeji byla jáma prohloubena na druhé patro v hloubce 425,65m. Hloubení bylo ukonceno v roce 1872 a težba uhlí zahájena v dubnu r. 1873. Dul byl propojen prekopem s dolem Bresson a úpadní chodbou na 4. patro dolu Barré.
Drevená težní vež z hraneného dreva byla vysoká 12,3m ke stredu lanovnic, které mely prumer 3,8m a mely drážku pro plochá lana. Težní klece byly dvouetážové. Parní težní stroj Quiball, belgické výroby, byl v cinnosti v letech 1870-1922. Pozdeji byl nahrazen elektrickým.
Puvodní drevená trídicka uhlí postavená v roce 1875 byla nahrazena novou v roce 1890 s výkonem 200 tisíc tun uhlí rocne. Roku 1895 bylo vybudováno uhelné prádlo proudového systému Wunderlich. Uhlí se nakládalo na vagony obsluhovaných vleckou z nádraží Kladno Ostrovec. Z duvodu zmenšující se težby na dole Bresson a nevyužití tamní trídírny byla roku 1902 vybudována povrchová lanová dráha pro dopravu uhlí od Bressonu na úpravnu Engerth.

Dul v roce 1914. Mine in 1914.

Spolecne s dolem Bresson patril dul Engerth k “nejohnivejším” dolum, byl provázen neustálými dulními zápary. Projevovaly se zde také nepríznivé tlakové pomery, kdy prujezdnost tratí v dole muselo zajištovat i více než sto údržbárských dvojic havíru “drevicu”.
V roce 1918 dul prechází do majetku Kamenouhelných dolu Kladno a pozdeji do vlastnictví Pražské železárské spolecnosti. Po roce 1936 byla težba prevedena pres dul Barré na dul Ronna v Hnidousích. Dul pretrval až do konce druhé svetové války a v roce 1946 byl zasypán. Definitivní zabezpecení jámy bylo provedeno v roce 1999. Podle dostupných údaju zde bylo do roku 1936 vyteženo 7 062 677 tun uhlí. Dul byl druhým nejdéle sloužícím dolem na Kladenském katastru. Težní budova byla snížena o dve horní patra a byla zachována až do dnešní doby. Naposled objekt sloužil jako prádelna a cistírna. U dolu stávala hornická kolonie, která byla v osmdesátých letech minulého století zborena a zastavena sídlištem.

 Celkový pohled na dul v roce 2011. General view of the mine in 2011.

[EN]
Coal Mine, which was opened by State Railways Company under the designation "Nr. V ", was one of the most important Kladno mines. It was named after the first general director of State Railways Company Wilhelm Engerth. He was significant Professor of Technical university in Graz.
The pit was cut in 1868 in a rectangular profile 6,635x2,22 m with three sections - southern ventilation, central extraction and northern climbing and water conduit section. At a depth of 386 m was uncovered coal vein thickness of about 9.48 m. The first floor was excavated at a depth of 390.58 m and the hole was deepened later on the second floor at a depth of 425.65 m. Digging was completed in 1872 and coal mining began in April 1873. Mine was connected with the mine Bresson and falls down the hall on the 4th Floor Barre mine.
The wooden tower was 12.3 m high to the center sheave, which had diameter 3.8m and had a slot for a flat cable. Mining cages were double storey. Steam extraction machine Quiball (Belgian production) was in operation from 1870-1922. Later replaced by electric one.
The original wooden coal sorter built in 1875 was replaced by a new in 1890 with a capacity of 200,000 tons of coal annually. In 1895, coal washery was built by Wunderlich turbojet system. The coal was loaded on the wagons of the train at the Kladno Ostrovec station. Due to dwindling mining at the mine Bresson and utilization of local sorter was built in 1902 the surface lift to transport coal from the Bresson to treatment plant at Engerth.


 
Bývalá hornická kolonie (80. léta minulého století). The former mining colony (80s of last century).

Together with mine mine Bresson, Engerth belonged to the "most fervent" mines, mine was accompanied by a constant mash. There were also negative pressure conditions, when pass-ability of the tracks in the mine had to maintenance more than a hundred pairs of miners “drevic".
In 1918 the mine passed into the possession of black coal mines in Kladno and later to property of the Prague Iron Company. After 1936, mining was transferred from Barre to the mine pit Ronna in Hnidousy. Mine lasted until the end of the Second World War and in 1946 was back-filled. The final security maintenance was made in 1999. According to available data, there were mined in 1936, 7 062 677 tons of coal. Mine was the second longest serving in Kladno land registry. Mining building was reduced to two upper floors and was maintained until today. For the last time, building was used for laundring and drying. The mine became a mining colony, which was in the eighties of last century demolished and built up settlement.



CACHE

[CZ]
Tato multicache vás provede okolím bývalého uhelného dolu. Z minulosti se dochovali težní a administrativní budovy, komín, odval hlušiny.

1.stage. N 50° 9.116' E 14° 5.348'
 Z jakého materiálu je vyroben název dolu na budove, pred kterou stojíš.
drevo A=2
kámen A=3
kov A=4
keramika A=5
plast A=6

2.stage. N 50° 9.127' E 14° 5.302'
 Kolik tycových jímacu má hromosvod na vrcholu stavby s temito souradnicemi. Pocet jímacu = B. V žádném prípade nevstupujte na soukromý majetek a do výšek už teprve ne! Použijte rozum a hlavne dobre lokalizujte stavbu.

3.stage. N 50° 9.(A*B)A+1' E 14° 5.A(B*(A+B))'
Ciferací druhého nejstaršího zaskleného letopoctu dostaneš císlo = C
Na stage je nejlepší jít od lesa.

4.stage. N 50° 9.(B-C-1)(C*(A+B))' E 14° 5.((C*(A+B))-A)C-1'
Ciferací roku narození nejvýchodneji zemrelého dostaneš = D

5.stage. N 50° 9.(B-C-1)D*C-D', E 14° 5.(A*A)(D*D-B)'
 Rozdílem první a poslední císlice evidencního císla poulicní lampy dostaneš císlo = E

Finále N 50° 9.(E*A)(D-A)C', E 14° 5.(E+D-C)((A+B)*B)'

 V prípade nepríznivých povetrnostních podmínek nemusí být nekteré stage odlovitelné. Poklad je ukrytý jako cerné zlato kladenské. Avšak k jeho vyzvednutí není dolu zapotrebí, ale mírného tlaku na hint. Vše po sobe peclive zamaskujte, at ostatním nezkazíte moment prekvapení. V okolí je velký provoz, dávejte pozor na mudly. Nezdá se to, ale v léte je zde docela rušno.

Prejeme vám príjemný lov a hodne zábavy.

 [EN]
This multicache will take you through surrounding of the former coalmine. From the past are preserved mining building, administrative building, chimney, heap dumps.

1.stage. N 50° 9.116' E 14° 5.348'
From which material is made signboard on the building, before which you stand.
wood A=2
stone A=3
metal A=4
ceramics A=5
plastics A=6

2.stage. N 50° 9.127' E 14° 5.302'
How many rod recievers are on top of a building with these coordinates. Number of receiver = B. In any case, do not try to get to private property or to buildings heights! Use common sense and make sure that you well-located the building.

3.stage. N 50° 9.(A*B)A+1' E 14° 5.A(B*(A+B))'
Digital root second oldest glazed epoch get number = C

4.stage. N 50° 9.(B-C-1)(C*(A+B))' E 14° 5.((C*(A+B))-A)C-1'
Digital root year of birth of the man who died at most eastern place, get the most easterly = D

5.stage. N 50° 9.(B-C-1)D*C-D', E 14° 5.(A*A)(D*D-B)'
Difference between the first and last digit registration number of the lamppost you get number= E

Final N 50° 9.(E*A)(D-A)C', E 14° 5.(E+D-C)((A+B)*B)'

In the event of adverse weather conditions some stages may not be uncatchable. The treasure is hidden as black gold of Kladno. But to capture it is not mine needed but you will have to make pressure on the hint. Everything carefully camouflage themselves and do not let others spoil the surprise. There are a lot of traffic, beware of Muggles. It does not seem it, but in summer is quite busy.

I wish you good hunting and a lot of fun.


Pokud jste zaregistrovaní na serveru Geocaching.cz, mužete tuto kešuli ohodnotit podle toho, jak se vám líbila.




Prehled zmen:
2.1.2012 – provedena terénní údržba
26.11.2011 – drobné zmeny listingu i fotografií

Title: Der Stromkasten
Description:
Ein kleiner Tradi im Dresdener Stadtteil Niedersedlitz.

Jetzt endlich zum 3. Versuch wurde mein Cache angenommen und ich hab endlich meinen Eigenen.

Zum Cache:

Es ist ein Drive-In, also könnt ihr direkt auf der Straße mit eurem Auto Parken. Zur Not ich auch ein kleiner Stellplatz vorhanden.

WICHTIG!!! Bitte Stift mitbringen. Es ist kein Stift in der Dose.

Viel Spass beim Suchen :D E-mInE

PS: Bitte wieder ordentlich Verstecken, auf Muggel achten und bei eventueller Beschädigung bescheid sagen.

Title: Dans la grotte
Description:
Pour cette cache, il faudra se garer à quelques mètres de l'entrée de la grotte.
évitez de faire demi tour a cet endroit car il n'y a pas de visibilité de la route et on y roule vite.

Il faut absolument avoir une lampe de poche et ne pas hésiter a se mettre à genou pour entrer.
il n'y a pas de risque a l'intérieur de la grotte, profondeur +/- 8 mètre et pas de gouffre ou de risque de chute, juste une petite pente, mais il faut toujours faire attention.

Bien re-cacher pour éviter les géomoldus.

Title: Inside the Cave
Description:
Inside the Cave
 
Bei diesem Cache handelt es sich um eine kleine (?) Höhle in Wallhalben. Hier war früher mal der Cache "Drive In Höhle" von "blum3ntopf". Aber da es diesen nicht mehr gibt, dachte Ich, ich leg dort selbst mal einen aus. Der Cache befindet sich im größten Raum der Höhle bzw. In der Ecke des größten Raumes.

Parkplatz: N 49° 18.782 E 007° 31.478
Final: N 49° 18.761 E 007° 31.442

Der Weg vom Parkplatz zum Cache (nur Hinweg) beträgt ca. 60 Meter!

Title: Dragon-Cave
Description:
Der Anblick eines Drachen bedeutet in Asien Glück. Ganz egal was danach geschehen mag!
Sie stehen für Frieden, für Wohlstand, Vorwärtskommen und langes Leben, vorausgesetzt, man überlebt eine Begegnung! -Bist du mutig genug die Herausforderung anzunehmen?

Dann fordere dein Glück gegen den Drachen CintoraS heraus. Finde das Buch des CintoraS und verewige dich darin. Sollte dir dies gelingen, wird das Gück dir ewig hold sein!

Title: Grotte de Troubat / Troubat cave
Description:
Des fouilles ont révélé des silex, des harpons, un propulseur, des sagaies en bois de cervidés, datant de 15 000 à 8 000 ans avant notre ère. On y a découvert de nombreux restes d'escargots, qui étaient utilisés comme réserve alimentaire.Cette grotte est maintenant vide et peut être explorée: frontale indispensable, casque conseillé. Elle est cependant assez petite et il n'existe pas de risque de se perdre, il est possible d'entrer par l'entrée principale et de sortir par l'autre entrée.
The explotration gave silex, harpoons, assegai made of elk woods dated 15000 y to 8000y BC. Some snails were also found that were the base of the food. This cave is now empty and can be visited. You need a light, and a helmet is also recomanded. It is small enough and you cannot get lost. You can go inside in the main entrance, and get out at the secondary one.

Title: Lourdes-Grotte
Description: Vor 70 Jahren hatte der damalige Pfarrer Emil Basler die Idee, oberhalb des Dorfkerns auf dem «Räbacherli» eine Lourdes-Grotte erstehen zu lassen. Männer und Jungmänner von Eiken machten sich tatkräftig ans Werk. Sie holten mit Pferdefuhrwerken in der Chinzhalde die Kalkfelsen, und unter fachkundiger Leitung eines Maurermeisters wurde die Grotte errichtet, wie sie heute noch zu sehen ist. Am 18. Mai 1939 wurde die Grotte vom damaligen Dekan Schmid feierlich eingeweiht. Trotzdem nehmen immer wieder viele Menschen den steilen beim Friedhof beginnenden Kreuzweg mit den 14 Stationen unter die Füsse. Wer alle Stationen sehen möchte sollte bei der Kirche parkieren, an der Strasse sind nur beschränkt Parkmöglichkeiten. Der Cache ist etwas von der Grotte entfernt und ist vom Weg her erreichbar. Ihr müsst nicht beim Felsen oder den Bänken suchen. Geniesse die Ruhe und die schöne Aussicht. Bitte Stift mitbringen.

Title: Höhle der Römer
Description:
Der Cache ist ein mittelgrosser, in Ihm sind Logbuch, Kuli und ein kleiner Tauschgegenstand (Bergkristall)

Die Koordinaten am Berg konnten nur +/- 12m ermittelt werden!

Koordinaten am Weg vor dem Aufstieg N 46°50.288 E 13°21.965

Happy Hunting!

FTF: Oliver P.

Title: La mine de cuivre de Cap Garonne
Description:
Free counters

[FRANCAIS]

En France, la plupart des régions ont connu une activité minière. Presque toutes sont aujourd’hui fermées. Mais la mémoire demeure et le tourisme minier se développe, notamment en région Provence-Alpes-Côte d’Azur. Le Sud-Est de la France comprend une grande diversité d’anciennes mines dans des paysages spendides. Les filons métalliques (plomb, zinc, fluorite), les petites mines de cuivre de Cap Garonne (au Pradet) et de Léouvé, et la mine de plomb argentifère de l’Argentière-la-Bessée sont des sites d’intérêt historique et touristique remarquable. Le bassin de lignite de Provence, les bassins de bauxite du Centre Var et des Baux (où fut identifié la bauxite) sont également des gisements de savoir-faire.
Cap Garonne se trouve à une douzaine de kilomètres au Sud-Est de Toulon. Il est constitué d'une masse de pélites et grès rouges du Permien, interstratifiés avec des basaltes également permiens, et surmontée en concordance par du Trias inférieur. Permien et Trias inférieur sont constitués de roches détritiques continentales d'origine fluviatile (grès, pélites, conglomérats…). L'ensemble est chevauché par le Paléozoïque légèrement métamorphique du socle provençal, dit socle des Maures / Cap Sicié.(Source : Pierre Thomas Laboratoire de Sciences de la Terre, ENS de Lyon)


[ENGLISH]

Most regions of France have experienced significant mining activity at some point in the past. Today, nearly all mining operations have ended, but the memory remains and mining heritage tourism is now developing. It is particularly important in the Provence-Alpes-Cote d’Azur region. A large number of old mines set in splendid landscapes can be found in the south of France. These include metallic ore mines for lead, zinc and fluorspar and small copper mines in the region of Cap Garonne (at Le Pradet). At L’Argentiere-la-Besse is an old lead and silver mine which is also of historical interest and attracts tourists. The lignite basin of Provence and bauxite basins of central Var and around Les Baux, where aluminium was invented, have become centres of mining expertise.
Cap Garonne is 12 km far from Toulon South-east. It’s a mass of pelite and Permian red sandstones, interstratified with also Permian basalts, and surmounted in agreement by Lower Triassic. Permian and Lower Triassic consist of continental detrital rocks of origin fluviatile (sandstone, pelites, conglomerates…). The unit is overlapped by Paleozoic slightly metamorphic base of Provence, known as base of the Maures/Cape Sicié. (Source: Pierre Thomas Laboratory of Earth sciences, ENS of Lyon).

Pour valider cette cache il vous faudra répondre aux questions suivantes et envoyer les réponses par MP à l'owner.
To validate this cache, it will be necessary for you to answer the following questions and to send the answers by PM to the owner.

A - What is the surface of the concession?
B - Où était envoyé le minerai de cuivre et pourquoi ?

C - Dimensions des galeries (Hauteur & largeur)?
C - Dimensions of the galleries (Height & width?
D - Qu'est-ce qu'une Rave de Saint Etienne?
D - What a "Rave de Saint Etienne" is?
E - Combien de minéraux ont été identifiés à Cap Garonne ?
E - How many minerals were identified in Cap Garonne?
F - Quels sont les minéraux les plus remarquables de Cap Garonne

G - Quelle est la couleur de la malachite ?
G - Which is the color of malachite

Une photo prise près des wagonnets de mine (à l'extérieur) serait appréciée

heures de visite : http://www.web-libre.org/breves/Le-Pradet,14275.html schedules of visit

Title: Hideout Cave
Description: This virtual cache is a small cave on top of a cliff in approx. 400 meters height. The coordinates are just in front of the entrance - with an accuracy of 4 meters! The way up the rock is very well hidden but can be done with good hiking boots and a firm grip. Nevertheless, this way is very dangerous, and a wrong step can result in serious injury or death. Definetely nothing for young children, dogs and people who cannot stand heights. The cache is virtual - to log it, write ME (not the log) an email describing the small cave.

Title: la miniera d'argento (the silver mine)
Description:
E’ una vera avventura giungere fino a questo cache, non tanto per il percorso che è molto agevole ma per la storia che lo riguarda.
Molte informazioni si possono avere navigando in internet a riguardo della miniera d’argento della Valganna, il solo giungervi vicino è come ritornare indietro nel passato in un’area che ricorda molto il territorio Americano dove era iniziata la conquista dell’oro, ma qui i ricordi si perdono addirittura nell’epoca romana.
L’area è selvaggia, lontano da rumori e strade ed è facile avvistare sull’opposto costone cervi o cinghiali al pascolo, salendo si possono trovare anche rocce di porfido con cristalli di galena e vecchi scarti della miniera con leggeri filamenti di argento e piombo.
L’interno della miniera si può visitare ma solo ed esclusivamente se si è provvisti di attrezzatura speleologica.
It is a true adventure to get to this chache, not only because the beautiful trip, which is very easy but also because the story about it.
On the web you can get lot of informations about the Silver Mine of Ganna Valley, it’s enough to get close to it to make a big jump in the past in a area very similar to the American territory where started the Gold Fever but here the memories get lost in the ancient roman age.
It’s a wild area, far from civilization noises and roads and it is very easy to sight deer and wild boars to the opposite side of the canyon, climbing you can find porphyry rocks with galena crystals and old mine’s waste with silver and lead filaments.

Title: Divaška jama / Divaca Cave
Description:
Go To English Text
Kazalo
*         Uvod
*         Obmocje zgornjega Krasa
*         Geologija in nastanek jame
*         Opis jame
*         EarthCache
*         Viri
Skok na konec teksta

Uvod
Divaška jama je nekoliko manj znana, a zato nic manj impozantna podzemna kraška jama v bližini Divace. Tudi njo je, podobno kot Škocjanske jame in še nekaj drugih, ustvarila skozi milijone let reka Reka, ki pa zdaj tece drugje in je zato Divaška jama suha jama.
Odkril jo je leta 1884 Gregor Žiberna, imenovan Tentava. Za turisticni obisk so jo uredili že tri leta za tem. Tentava se je pred tem prvi spustil v številne jame, med njimi tudi v 180 m globoko vhodno brezno Kacne Jame, ki leži nedalec stran od Divaške jame in vodi do podzemnega toka Reke. S tem se je proslavil kot veliki raziskovalec kraškega podzemlja ob koncu 19. stoletja.
Jama je eden najstarejših ohranjenih rovov reke Reke, ki danes nedalec stran ponika v znamenite Škocjanske jame. Ogled je zanimiv, saj je jama z množico udornih dolin in brezen v okolici Divace del nekdaj aktivnega jamskega sistema, ki ga je na tem obmocju oblikovala Reka. Je izvrstna priložnost za spoznavanje in razumevanje razvoja kraških pojavov na Divaškem Krasu. Skozi dolgo geološko zgodovino se je skoraj v celotnem rovu odložilo veliko sige, ki z zanimivimi tvorbami krasi njeno notranjost. Že v preteklosti so jamo obiskovale znane osebnosti. Med njimi velja izpostaviti prestolonaslednika princa Rudolfa, po katerem se je nekaj casa tudi imenovala Rudolfova jama (Rudolfsgrotte), in slovitega psihoanalitika Sigmunda Freuda.
Obmocje zgornjega Krasa

Geološka zgradba Maticnega krasa


Generalizirana geološka karta Krasa (Cerkvenik, 2005)

Celotni Maticni Kras, apnencasto podolje med Tržaškim zalivom in Vipavsko dolino, je razgibana enota. Eocenski fliš, morski sediment, ki je na debelo prekrival to podrocje, se je dvignil nad morsko gladino in nato vzdrževal površinsko recno mrežo. Ob dvigovanju, gubanju in nato prelamljanju plasti je bila antiklinalna guba Krasa razgaljena in erodirana do starejših apnencev, vecinoma kredne starosti, kjer so se zaceli kraški procesi. Za Zgornji Kras je znacilno stikanje med apnenci in fliši, tako da so apnenci spodaj, fliš pa je naložen na njih. Vzhodno od Zgornjega Krasa so flišni Brkini, kjer je recna mreža površinska, celotna recna mreža pa se steka vecinoma na zahod, kjer se ponori Reke koncajo v Škocjanskem jamskem spletu, in na jug z mnogimi krajšimi vodotoki, ki se koncajo v ponorih v tako imenovanih slepih dolinah Matarskega podolja.

Morfološke enote Krasa in okolice (Gams, 2003)

Ponori primorske Reke so v geološki zgodovini ustvarili velikanski sistem podzemeljskih rovov in dvoran, v razlicnih višinah in v razlicnih smereh proti zahodu, severozahodu in jugozahodu. Erozijsko širjenje in poglabljanje ter znižanje korozijskega površja je ustvarjalo notranje podore, ožine in udorne vrtace s površja, zato je Reka stalno spreminjala svoj tok v globini, ceprav je vsaj v prvih desetih kilometrih sklenjen. Ob poplavah voda Reke zapolni višje rove. Škocjanske jame in Kacna jama sta del tega sistema, del starega višjega in zdaj mrtvega sistema pa je tudi Divaška jama.  

Hidrogeološka karta Krasa (Mihevc, 2004)

Geologija in nastanek jame
Širše obmocje Divaške jame tvorijo mikritni in sparitni kredni apnenci turonijske starosti, ki  sestavljajo veliko geološko gubo tako imenovanega tržaško-komenskega antiklinorija. Skladi upadajo za 20 stopinj proti jugu in jugozahodu. Skladi  so prelomljeni, vendar le malo zdrobljeni.
Podzemlje Divaške jame je v skladovitih apnencih, ki so v prvi polovici jame nagnjeni za 15-20 stopinj proti jugozahodu, v drugi polovici pa za prav toliko proti jugu. Ker skalni profili jame niso nikjer v celoti razgaljeni, je težavno spoznati tudi razsežnosti in oblike skalne izvotlitve. Gre za enotni rov, ceprav  skorajda popolnoma preoblikovan. Zelo verjetno je sedanji rov le vrh velikega podzemeljskega kanjona. Lepo so razvidne velike zapolnitve prostorov z ilovico, podori in sigami skorajda do vrha, nato pa je z mocnim izpiranjem z meteorskimi vodami prišlo do ponovne izvotljenosti podzemeljskega rova med vhodom 426 m do 350 m nadmorske višine z dolžino kakšnih 700 m. V zadnji fazi se je jama ponovno mocno zasigala z mnogimi sigastimi oblikami (stalagmiti, stalaktiti, stebri, zavese, baldahini itd.), tako da težko najdemo živo skalo.
Opis jame

Nacrt jame

Divaška jama ima dva vzporedna navpicna vhoda na nadmorski višini 427 m. Zdajšnji glavni je vhod skozi udorno vrtaco, kjer je speljana pot, ter se na dnu zoži (tu je bil skopan umetni prehod že leta 1886) in pride po podornem nasipu v Vhodno dvorano. Ob robu podorne vrtace pa se v Vhodno dvorano navpicno spusti v 25 m globoko brezno, prva leta edini prehod v jamo, ki so ga premošcali z vrvnimi in nato z lesenimi lestvami.
V vhodnem prostoru,  imenovanem Plesna dvorana (Vhodna dvorana), kamor še sega dnevna svetloba,  so  tla umetno poravnana. Od tu  vodi  17 m širok in 15 m visok podzemeljski rov in jamska pot pod podrtim stalagmitom. Na JZ skalni steni se vzpenjajo kope sige in debeli stalagmiti, od katerih sta dva v podnožju prelomljena in nagnjena. Dno vhodnega rova se spušca do najnižjega dela prostora, kjer se pozimi zadržuje hladen zrak, poleti pa se zrak dnevno ohlaja zaradi nocnih temperatur. Zaradi tega je siga v rovu posebne sive barve in oblike.  Po 80 m se vhodni rov konca,  dvigne in zoži do stranske niše, imenovane Samotarjeva molilnica.
Jamska pot pelje cez Prehod Šipka (Obhod) v Šipka sotesko, 20 m dolg odsek jame, posut z množico velikih stalagmitov, kjer se mešata vhodni in jamski zrak. Šipka (robidovje) je staro ime za ta del jame zaradi koralastih izrastkov po stenah in kapnikih.
Rov se rahlo spusti in tu ni vec  vplivov z vhoda in pozimi nas objame toplejši in vedno vlažen zrak. Tla rova, polnega kop, sigovih cipres in svec, se znižajo, rov pa se poveca in razširi v 40 m dolgo Dvorano kralja Matjaža (Rešaverjevo dvorano), z  markantnimi kapniškimi oblikami in podrtim mogocnim stalagmitom Kralj Matjaž, po Gospodaricu imenovanem Harambaša, nad njim pa stoji stalagmit Kralj Samo (nekaj casa znan tudi kot Tegethoffov spomenik). Na steni je lep bel sigast Slap Savice. Na dnu dvorane je udor Pekel, po Gospodaricu Hram; od tu vodi odcep v stranski rov v Malo jamo, po Žiberni imenovan Muzej umetnosti.
Glavni rov se nato zožuje cez Sotesko slapov (Hodnik), dolžine 30 m, kjer se zoži na 5m širine, z znacilnimi slapovi sige na stranskih stenah. Rov se kmalu razširi in dvigne v 70 m dolgo Kalvarijo ( po Gospodaricu Pretnerjevo dvorano), kjer je znacilno kapniško pobocje z gozdom stalagmitov in stebrov. Tu se jamska pot  razcepi - na levi strani Kalvarije poteka glavna pot ob vznožju pobocja, na desni strani pa se dvigne in spusti ter se spet združi z glavno levo potjo.
Turisticna jamska  pot  se nadaljuje na razgledni rob Belvedere, kjer se odpre pogled na Veliko dvorano, kot so jo imenovali Tentava in tovariši. Rov je  100m dolg, do 40 m širok in do 20m visok. Zdaj ga imenujemo Žibernova dvorana. Jamska pot se strmo serpentinasto spusti na dno dvorane, ki je tudi najnižja tocka jame, 72 m nižje in 500 m dalec od vhoda. Tu je prehod v 20 m globoko ožje brezno. Ob poti je zanimiv stalagmit Atilova pipa, kot ga je poimenoval Tentava. Jamska turisticna pot  se spet dvigne na Turški britof, kjer se na desno odcepi stranska pot v Biserno Vilenico in Zakladnico z mnogimi belo-rdecimi zavesami, helektitnimi izrastki in velikimi kristali. Glavna pot se v zgornjem delu dvorane spet razcepi. Na desni strani je stranski strmi kapniški rov, nekoc imenovan Štefanijin balkon, na levi strani pa lepo zasigan podor s kapniškimi skupinami Kronski gric in Spomenik princa Rudolfa. Jama se konca z dvignjenim kapniškim rovom, imenovanim Nebesa ali Paradižem in Nebeškimi orglami.
V dvorani kralja Matjaža, kjer je severni odcep v Malo jamo, ki jo je Tentava imenoval Muzej umetnosti,  je jamska pot prehodna samo z mostom cez prepad Pekel (po  Gospodaricu Hram), ki je do 10 m globok s 30 m dolgim rovom na dnu. Mala jama je dolga do 60 m, posejana  z mnogimi lepimi kapniškimi oblikami: stalagmiti Mumije, Cipresa in Kitajska vaza, s strani pa visi velik baldahin, s katerega raste stalaktit Slonov rilec.  Kapniški rov se konca z  udorom v sigini plošci, poimenovan  Katakombe.
Celotna dolžina Divaške jame je 700 m,  globina pa 95 m. V njej je speljanih 1500 m poti, za turisticne oglede pa je le poredko odprta. Za vec informacij o ogledu se velja obrniti na skrbnika, Jamarsko društvo Gregor Žiberna iz Divace.
EarthCache
Vhod v Divaško jamo je enostavno dostopen s ceste Divaca – Lokev na Krasu - Lipica, kjer nas po kilometru ali dveh izven Divace obcestna tabla usmeri desno. Nekaj deset metrov naprej je parkirišce (tocka PARK), do vhoda pa je še nekaj metrov hoje, ki nas spusti v kraško vrtaco, na dnu katere je vhod v jamo (tocka CAVE).
Za registracijo te EarthCache tocke morate odgovoriti na naslednja vprašanja:
1.       Ocenite dimenzije (globina in premer) vrtace, v kateri je vhod v jamo.
2.       Konec Divaške jame (Nebesa) sega skoraj do še ene kraške jame v bližini, le da je približno 50 m pod njo. Za katero jamo gre?
3.       Koliko stopnic je do železnih vrat, ki zapirajo vhod v jamo?
4.       Kot neobvezno nalogo pa naredite fotografijo vas ali vašega GPSja pri jami in jo pripnite vašemu vpisu.
Odgovore mi pošljite skozi GC profil. Potem lahko zabeležite vaš obisk, ne da bi cakali na posebno dovoljenje. Ce ste fotografirali, priložite zanimive fotografije.

Vpisi brez poslanih spremljajocih odgovorov, ali vpisi, ki vsebujejo odgovore na vprašanja, bodo izbrisani!
Skok na zacetek teksta
Skok na konec teksta


Table of Contents
*         Introduction
*         Upper Karst area
*         Geology and formation of the Cave
*         Description of the Cave
*         EarthCache
*         Sources
Go To Bottom

Introduction

Divaca cave is somewhat less known, but no less impressive underground Karst cave near Divaca. It was, like Škocjan caves and a few others, created over millions of years by the river Reka, which now runs elsewhere, making Divaca cave a dry cave.
Cave was discovered in 1884 by Gregor Žiberna, called Tentava. It was arranged for tourist visits three years after that. Tentava was the first to go into a number of caves before that, including the 180-meter deep entrance shaft of Kacna cave, which lies not far from Divaca cave, leading to an underground river Reka. These successes made him one of the greatest  explorers of  karst underground in the late 19 century.
The cave is one of the oldest surviving passages of the river Reka, which currently terminates near the famous Škocjan caves. Visiting Divaca cave makes an interesting tour, since together with numerous collapse valleys and shafts in the vicinity of Divaca it is a part of once active cave system, which was formed by river Reka. It is an excellent opportunity to learn and understand the development of karst phenomena in Divaca Karst. Through a long geological history, almost the entire tunnel became richly decorated with interesting calcite formations. Historically, many celebrities have visited this cave. Among them, we should mention Crown Prince Rudolf, after whom the cave was one time called Rudolph Cave (Rudolfsgrotte), and the famous psychoanalyst Sigmund Freud.
Upper Karst area

Karst geological structure


Generalized Geological Map of Karst (Cerkvenik, 2005)

Whole central Karst, limestone valley between the Gulf of Trieste and Vipava Valley, is a very diverse area. Eocene flysch, marine sediment, which was thickly covering this area, rose above the sea level and then maintain the surface river network. When lifting, corrugation, and then breaking of layers, Karst anticlinal fold was exposed and then eroded to the older limestone, mostly of Cretaceous age, where karst processes began. Characteristic for the upper Karst is juncture between the limestone and flysch, so that the limestone is on the bottom while flysch is loaded on it. East of the Upper Karst lay flysch Brkini, where the water network runs on the surface. Entire water network is channeled mainly to the west, where the river Reka sinks in Škocjan Caves, and to the south with many short streams that end up in the sinks of Matarska valley.

Morphological units of Karst and surroundings (Gams, 2003)

River Reka created in the geological history a huge underground system of tunnels and chambers in various heights and in different directions: towards the west, northwest and southwest. Erosion and reduction of surface materials caused surface cavings and sinkholes  which have been constantly changing flow of the river, although at least the first ten kilometers are uninterrupted. During floods river Reka still fills some of the higher galleries. Kacna Cave and Škocjan caves are part of this system, whereas the Divaca cave is higher and part of the old and now dead cave system.

Karst Hydrogeological map (Mihevc, 2004)

Geology and formation of the Cave
The wider area of Divaca cave consists of cretaceous limestone, which forms a geological fold. These limestone stratification decreases by 20 degrees to the south and southwest. They are broken, but only a little crushed.
Divaca cave underground lies in stratified limestone which in the first half is inclined 15-20 degrees to the southwest, in the second half by as much towards the south. Since the rock profiles are nowhere in the cave completely stripped down, it is difficult to know the dimensions and shape of rock hollowing. The cave is a single tunnel, although almost completely reshaped. It is likely just the tip of the large underground canyon. In the final stage the cave again became filled with many forms of calcite (stalagmites, stalactites, columns, curtains, canopies, etc.), which makes finding bedrock very difficult.
Description of the Cave

Cave plan

Divaca cave has two parallel vertical inputs at an altitude of 427 m. The current main entrance is through a karst sinkhole, where the path leads and narrows at the bottom (there was an artificial passage dug already in 1886) to eventually enter the Entrance Hall. By the edge of the sinkhole there’s a vertical 25 m deep shaft that leads directly to the Entrance Hall. In the first few years this was the only way to enter the cave, with ropes or wooden ladders.
In  the entrance room, called the Dance Hall (Entrance Hall), where there’s still daylight, floor was artificially leveled.  From here the path leads through 17 m wide and 15 m high underground tunnel, under a fallen stalagmite. On the SW rock wall there are piles of calcite and thick stalagmites, two of which are at the foot broken and skewed. The bottom of the input shaft descends to the lowest part of the area where in the winter cold air is trapped and in the summer air is cooled by the night temperatures. Because of this calcite formations have special gray color and shape. After 80 m, the input shaft ends, ascents and tightens into a side niche, called Samotarjeva Molilnica (Loner’s  Oratory).
Cave path then leads through the Šipka Pass (Bypass) into the Šipka gorge, 20 m long section of the cave, strewn with a multitude of large stalagmites, where the cave and outside air are mixing. Šipka (bramble) is an old name for this part of the cave because of coral-like growths on the walls and dripstones.
Passage then drops slightly and outside air can no longer be felt but instead there’s warmer and always moist cave air.  Soon passage widens to 40 m long Hall of King Matjaž (a.k.a. Rešaver Hall), with impressive dripstones and mighty fallen stalagmite named King Matjaž (Gospodaric called it Harambaša) and above it there’s stalagmite King Samo (also known for some time as a monument of Tegethoff). On the wall is a beautiful white Savica Waterfall. At the bottom of the hall there’s landslip Pekel (Hell) and from there tunnel branches to  Little cave, which Žiberna called Art Museum.
The main tunnel then narrows into the 30 m long Gorge of Waterfalls (Hallway), where it narrows to a width of 5m, with typical calcite waterfalls on the side walls. The tunnel will soon expand and rise into the 70 m long Calvary (Gospodaric called it Pretner Hall), which is characterized by slope with a forest of stalagmites and columns. Here are the cave path splits - on the left side of Calvary the principal route runs at the foot of the slope while on the right hand side it raises and drops again to join the main left path.
Tourist cave path continues to the edge of the Belvedere lookout, where the view opens to the Great Hall, as was dubbed by Tentava and comrades. The tunnel is 100m long, up to 40 m wide and up to 20m high. Nowadays it is called Žiberna Hall. Path then descends sharply to the bottom of the hall, which is also the lowest point of the cave, 72 m lower and 500 m far from the entrance. Here is a passage to the 20 m deep narrow pit. On the way there’s an interesting stalagmite that Tentava named Attila's pipe. Tourist trail rises again to the Turkish graveyard where on the right side road branches off to Pearl Vilenica and Treasury with many white-red curtains and large crystals. The main trail splits again in the upper part of the hall. On the right hand side there’s steep tunnel, once called Štefanija balcony, and on the left side a beautiful rockfall with stalactite groups, Crown Hill, and Crown Prince Rudolf Monument. The cave ends with a raised tunnel called Heaven or Paradise and with Heaven organ.
In the hall of King Matjaž with the branch to the Little cave, which was called by Tentava the Art Museum, the cave trail is only transitive over a bridge across the abyss of Hell which is up to 10 m deep with a 30 m long tunnel at the bottom. Little cave is 60 m long, planted with many beautiful calcite forms: Mummies stalagmites, Cypress and China vase, while on the side hangs a large canopy, from which the stalactite Elephant Trunk grows. Passage ends with a landslip, called the Catacombs.
The entire length of the Divaca cave is 700 m and it is 95 m deep. There are 1500 m of visitor’s route, but it is seldom open for visitors. For more information about visiting contact the administrator, the Speleological Society Gregor Žiberna in Divaca.
EarthCache
The entrance to the Divaca Cave is easily accessible from the road Divaca - Lokev na Krasu - Lipica, where after a kilometer or two outside Divaca a roadside sign will direct you to the right. Very soon you’ll arrive to the parking space (waypoint PARK). From there one has to walk for a few meters into the karst sinkhole at the bottom of which the entrance to the cave is (waypoint CAVE).
To register this EarthCache you must answer the following questions:
1.       Assess the dimensions (depth and diameter) of the sinkhole in which the entrance to the cave is.
2.       End of the Divaca Cave (Heaven = Nebesa) extends almost to another cave nearby, but is approximately 50 m below it. Which cave is this?
3.       How many steps are there on the staircase to the iron gate that closes the entrance to the cave? Count all steps not just the metal ones.
4.       Optionally, take a photo of yourself or your GPS and attach it to your log.
Send your answers through my GC profile. After that you can log your visit, don't wait for permission from me. If you took photos, attach them to your log.
Logs without the answers sent to me or logs containing the answers will be deleted!

Title: Divaška jama / Divaca Cave
Description:
Go To English Text
Kazalo
*         Uvod
*         Obmocje zgornjega Krasa
*         Geologija in nastanek jame
*         Opis jame
*         EarthCache
*         Viri
Skok na konec teksta

Uvod
Divaška jama je nekoliko manj znana, a zato nic manj impozantna podzemna kraška jama v bližini Divace. Tudi njo je, podobno kot Škocjanske jame in še nekaj drugih, ustvarila skozi milijone let reka Reka, ki pa zdaj tece drugje in je zato Divaška jama suha jama.
Odkril jo je leta 1884 Gregor Žiberna, imenovan Tentava. Za turisticni obisk so jo uredili že tri leta za tem. Tentava se je pred tem prvi spustil v številne jame, med njimi tudi v 180 m globoko vhodno brezno Kacne Jame, ki leži nedalec stran od Divaške jame in vodi do podzemnega toka Reke. S tem se je proslavil kot veliki raziskovalec kraškega podzemlja ob koncu 19. stoletja.
Jama je eden najstarejših ohranjenih rovov reke Reke, ki danes nedalec stran ponika v znamenite Škocjanske jame. Ogled je zanimiv, saj je jama z množico udornih dolin in brezen v okolici Divace del nekdaj aktivnega jamskega sistema, ki ga je na tem obmocju oblikovala Reka. Je izvrstna priložnost za spoznavanje in razumevanje razvoja kraških pojavov na Divaškem Krasu. Skozi dolgo geološko zgodovino se je skoraj v celotnem rovu odložilo veliko sige, ki z zanimivimi tvorbami krasi njeno notranjost. Že v preteklosti so jamo obiskovale znane osebnosti. Med njimi velja izpostaviti prestolonaslednika princa Rudolfa, po katerem se je nekaj casa tudi imenovala Rudolfova jama (Rudolfsgrotte), in slovitega psihoanalitika Sigmunda Freuda.
Obmocje zgornjega Krasa

Geološka zgradba Maticnega krasa


Generalizirana geološka karta Krasa (Cerkvenik, 2005)

Celotni Maticni Kras, apnencasto podolje med Tržaškim zalivom in Vipavsko dolino, je razgibana enota. Eocenski fliš, morski sediment, ki je na debelo prekrival to podrocje, se je dvignil nad morsko gladino in nato vzdrževal površinsko recno mrežo. Ob dvigovanju, gubanju in nato prelamljanju plasti je bila antiklinalna guba Krasa razgaljena in erodirana do starejših apnencev, vecinoma kredne starosti, kjer so se zaceli kraški procesi. Za Zgornji Kras je znacilno stikanje med apnenci in fliši, tako da so apnenci spodaj, fliš pa je naložen na njih. Vzhodno od Zgornjega Krasa so flišni Brkini, kjer je recna mreža površinska, celotna recna mreža pa se steka vecinoma na zahod, kjer se ponori Reke koncajo v Škocjanskem jamskem spletu, in na jug z mnogimi krajšimi vodotoki, ki se koncajo v ponorih v tako imenovanih slepih dolinah Matarskega podolja.

Morfološke enote Krasa in okolice (Gams, 2003)

Ponori primorske Reke so v geološki zgodovini ustvarili velikanski sistem podzemeljskih rovov in dvoran, v razlicnih višinah in v razlicnih smereh proti zahodu, severozahodu in jugozahodu. Erozijsko širjenje in poglabljanje ter znižanje korozijskega površja je ustvarjalo notranje podore, ožine in udorne vrtace s površja, zato je Reka stalno spreminjala svoj tok v globini, ceprav je vsaj v prvih desetih kilometrih sklenjen. Ob poplavah voda Reke zapolni višje rove. Škocjanske jame in Kacna jama sta del tega sistema, del starega višjega in zdaj mrtvega sistema pa je tudi Divaška jama.  

Hidrogeološka karta Krasa (Mihevc, 2004)

Geologija in nastanek jame
Širše obmocje Divaške jame tvorijo mikritni in sparitni kredni apnenci turonijske starosti, ki  sestavljajo veliko geološko gubo tako imenovanega tržaško-komenskega antiklinorija. Skladi upadajo za 20 stopinj proti jugu in jugozahodu. Skladi  so prelomljeni, vendar le malo zdrobljeni.
Podzemlje Divaške jame je v skladovitih apnencih, ki so v prvi polovici jame nagnjeni za 15-20 stopinj proti jugozahodu, v drugi polovici pa za prav toliko proti jugu. Ker skalni profili jame niso nikjer v celoti razgaljeni, je težavno spoznati tudi razsežnosti in oblike skalne izvotlitve. Gre za enotni rov, ceprav  skorajda popolnoma preoblikovan. Zelo verjetno je sedanji rov le vrh velikega podzemeljskega kanjona. Lepo so razvidne velike zapolnitve prostorov z ilovico, podori in sigami skorajda do vrha, nato pa je z mocnim izpiranjem z meteorskimi vodami prišlo do ponovne izvotljenosti podzemeljskega rova med vhodom 426 m do 350 m nadmorske višine z dolžino kakšnih 700 m. V zadnji fazi se je jama ponovno mocno zasigala z mnogimi sigastimi oblikami (stalagmiti, stalaktiti, stebri, zavese, baldahini itd.), tako da težko najdemo živo skalo.
Opis jame

Nacrt jame

Divaška jama ima dva vzporedna navpicna vhoda na nadmorski višini 427 m. Zdajšnji glavni je vhod skozi udorno vrtaco, kjer je speljana pot, ter se na dnu zoži (tu je bil skopan umetni prehod že leta 1886) in pride po podornem nasipu v Vhodno dvorano. Ob robu podorne vrtace pa se v Vhodno dvorano navpicno spusti v 25 m globoko brezno, prva leta edini prehod v jamo, ki so ga premošcali z vrvnimi in nato z lesenimi lestvami.
V vhodnem prostoru,  imenovanem Plesna dvorana (Vhodna dvorana), kamor še sega dnevna svetloba,  so  tla umetno poravnana. Od tu  vodi  17 m širok in 15 m visok podzemeljski rov in jamska pot pod podrtim stalagmitom. Na JZ skalni steni se vzpenjajo kope sige in debeli stalagmiti, od katerih sta dva v podnožju prelomljena in nagnjena. Dno vhodnega rova se spušca do najnižjega dela prostora, kjer se pozimi zadržuje hladen zrak, poleti pa se zrak dnevno ohlaja zaradi nocnih temperatur. Zaradi tega je siga v rovu posebne sive barve in oblike.  Po 80 m se vhodni rov konca,  dvigne in zoži do stranske niše, imenovane Samotarjeva molilnica.
Jamska pot pelje cez Prehod Šipka (Obhod) v Šipka sotesko, 20 m dolg odsek jame, posut z množico velikih stalagmitov, kjer se mešata vhodni in jamski zrak. Šipka (robidovje) je staro ime za ta del jame zaradi koralastih izrastkov po stenah in kapnikih.
Rov se rahlo spusti in tu ni vec  vplivov z vhoda in pozimi nas objame toplejši in vedno vlažen zrak. Tla rova, polnega kop, sigovih cipres in svec, se znižajo, rov pa se poveca in razširi v 40 m dolgo Dvorano kralja Matjaža (Rešaverjevo dvorano), z  markantnimi kapniškimi oblikami in podrtim mogocnim stalagmitom Kralj Matjaž, po Gospodaricu imenovanem Harambaša, nad njim pa stoji stalagmit Kralj Samo (nekaj casa znan tudi kot Tegethoffov spomenik). Na steni je lep bel sigast Slap Savice. Na dnu dvorane je udor Pekel, po Gospodaricu Hram; od tu vodi odcep v stranski rov v Malo jamo, po Žiberni imenovan Muzej umetnosti.
Glavni rov se nato zožuje cez Sotesko slapov (Hodnik), dolžine 30 m, kjer se zoži na 5m širine, z znacilnimi slapovi sige na stranskih stenah. Rov se kmalu razširi in dvigne v 70 m dolgo Kalvarijo ( po Gospodaricu Pretnerjevo dvorano), kjer je znacilno kapniško pobocje z gozdom stalagmitov in stebrov. Tu se jamska pot  razcepi - na levi strani Kalvarije poteka glavna pot ob vznožju pobocja, na desni strani pa se dvigne in spusti ter se spet združi z glavno levo potjo.
Turisticna jamska  pot  se nadaljuje na razgledni rob Belvedere, kjer se odpre pogled na Veliko dvorano, kot so jo imenovali Tentava in tovariši. Rov je  100m dolg, do 40 m širok in do 20m visok. Zdaj ga imenujemo Žibernova dvorana. Jamska pot se strmo serpentinasto spusti na dno dvorane, ki je tudi najnižja tocka jame, 72 m nižje in 500 m dalec od vhoda. Tu je prehod v 20 m globoko ožje brezno. Ob poti je zanimiv stalagmit Atilova pipa, kot ga je poimenoval Tentava. Jamska turisticna pot  se spet dvigne na Turški britof, kjer se na desno odcepi stranska pot v Biserno Vilenico in Zakladnico z mnogimi belo-rdecimi zavesami, helektitnimi izrastki in velikimi kristali. Glavna pot se v zgornjem delu dvorane spet razcepi. Na desni strani je stranski strmi kapniški rov, nekoc imenovan Štefanijin balkon, na levi strani pa lepo zasigan podor s kapniškimi skupinami Kronski gric in Spomenik princa Rudolfa. Jama se konca z dvignjenim kapniškim rovom, imenovanim Nebesa ali Paradižem in Nebeškimi orglami.
V dvorani kralja Matjaža, kjer je severni odcep v Malo jamo, ki jo je Tentava imenoval Muzej umetnosti,  je jamska pot prehodna samo z mostom cez prepad Pekel (po  Gospodaricu Hram), ki je do 10 m globok s 30 m dolgim rovom na dnu. Mala jama je dolga do 60 m, posejana  z mnogimi lepimi kapniškimi oblikami: stalagmiti Mumije, Cipresa in Kitajska vaza, s strani pa visi velik baldahin, s katerega raste stalaktit Slonov rilec.  Kapniški rov se konca z  udorom v sigini plošci, poimenovan  Katakombe.
Celotna dolžina Divaške jame je 700 m,  globina pa 95 m. V njej je speljanih 1500 m poti, za turisticne oglede pa je le poredko odprta. Za vec informacij o ogledu se velja obrniti na skrbnika, Jamarsko društvo Gregor Žiberna iz Divace.
EarthCache
Vhod v Divaško jamo je enostavno dostopen s ceste Divaca – Lokev na Krasu - Lipica, kjer nas po kilometru ali dveh izven Divace obcestna tabla usmeri desno. Nekaj deset metrov naprej je parkirišce (tocka PARK), do vhoda pa je še nekaj metrov hoje, ki nas spusti v kraško vrtaco, na dnu katere je vhod v jamo (tocka CAVE).
Za registracijo te EarthCache tocke morate odgovoriti na naslednja vprašanja:
1.       Ocenite dimenzije (globina in premer) vrtace, v kateri je vhod v jamo.
2.       Konec Divaške jame (Nebesa) sega skoraj do še ene kraške jame v bližini, le da je približno 50 m pod njo. Za katero jamo gre?
3.       Koliko stopnic je do železnih vrat, ki zapirajo vhod v jamo?
4.       Kot neobvezno nalogo pa naredite fotografijo vas ali vašega GPSja pri jami in jo pripnite vašemu vpisu.
Odgovore mi pošljite skozi GC profil. Potem lahko zabeležite vaš obisk, ne da bi cakali na posebno dovoljenje. Ce ste fotografirali, priložite zanimive fotografije.

Vpisi brez poslanih spremljajocih odgovorov, ali vpisi, ki vsebujejo odgovore na vprašanja, bodo izbrisani!

Table of Contents
*         Introduction
*         Upper Karst area
*         Geology and formation of the Cave
*         Description of the Cave
*         EarthCache

Go To Bottom

Introduction

Divaca cave is somewhat less known, but no less impressive underground Karst cave near Divaca. It was, like Škocjan caves and a few others, created over millions of years by the river Reka, which now runs elsewhere, making Divaca cave a dry cave.
Cave was discovered in 1884 by Gregor Žiberna, called Tentava. It was arranged for tourist visits three years after that. Tentava was the first to go into a number of caves before that, including the 180-meter deep entrance shaft of Kacna cave, which lies not far from Divaca cave, leading to an underground river Reka. These successes made him one of the greatest  explorers of  karst underground in the late 19 century.
The cave is one of the oldest surviving passages of the river Reka, which currently terminates near the famous Škocjan caves. Visiting Divaca cave makes an interesting tour, since together with numerous collapse valleys and shafts in the vicinity of Divaca it is a part of once active cave system, which was formed by river Reka. It is an excellent opportunity to learn and understand the development of karst phenomena in Divaca Karst. Through a long geological history, almost the entire tunnel became richly decorated with interesting calcite formations. Historically, many celebrities have visited this cave. Among them, we should mention Crown Prince Rudolf, after whom the cave was one time called Rudolph Cave (Rudolfsgrotte), and the famous psychoanalyst Sigmund Freud.
Upper Karst area

Karst geological structure


Generalized Geological Map of Karst (Cerkvenik, 2005)

Whole central Karst, limestone valley between the Gulf of Trieste and Vipava Valley, is a very diverse area. Eocene flysch, marine sediment, which was thickly covering this area, rose above the sea level and then maintain the surface river network. When lifting, corrugation, and then breaking of layers, Karst anticlinal fold was exposed and then eroded to the older limestone, mostly of Cretaceous age, where karst processes began. Characteristic for the upper Karst is juncture between the limestone and flysch, so that the limestone is on the bottom while flysch is loaded on it. East of the Upper Karst lay flysch Brkini, where the water network runs on the surface. Entire water network is channeled mainly to the west, where the river Reka sinks in Škocjan Caves, and to the south with many short streams that end up in the sinks of Matarska valley.

Morphological units of Karst and surroundings (Gams, 2003)

River Reka created in the geological history a huge underground system of tunnels and chambers in various heights and in different directions: towards the west, northwest and southwest. Erosion and reduction of surface materials caused surface cavings and sinkholes  which have been constantly changing flow of the river, although at least the first ten kilometers are uninterrupted. During floods river Reka still fills some of the higher galleries. Kacna Cave and Škocjan caves are part of this system, whereas the Divaca cave is higher and part of the old and now dead cave system.

Karst Hydrogeological map (Mihevc, 2004)

Geology and formation of the Cave
The wider area of Divaca cave consists of cretaceous limestone, which forms a geological fold. These limestone stratification decreases by 20 degrees to the south and southwest. They are broken, but only a little crushed.
Divaca cave underground lies in stratified limestone which in the first half is inclined 15-20 degrees to the southwest, in the second half by as much towards the south. Since the rock profiles are nowhere in the cave completely stripped down, it is difficult to know the dimensions and shape of rock hollowing. The cave is a single tunnel, although almost completely reshaped. It is likely just the tip of the large underground canyon. In the final stage the cave again became filled with many forms of calcite (stalagmites, stalactites, columns, curtains, canopies, etc.), which makes finding bedrock very difficult.
Description of the Cave

Cave plan

Divaca cave has two parallel vertical inputs at an altitude of 427 m. The current main entrance is through a karst sinkhole, where the path leads and narrows at the bottom (there was an artificial passage dug already in 1886) to eventually enter the Entrance Hall. By the edge of the sinkhole there’s a vertical 25 m deep shaft that leads directly to the Entrance Hall. In the first few years this was the only way to enter the cave, with ropes or wooden ladders.
In  the entrance room, called the Dance Hall (Entrance Hall), where there’s still daylight, floor was artificially leveled.  From here the path leads through 17 m wide and 15 m high underground tunnel, under a fallen stalagmite. On the SW rock wall there are piles of calcite and thick stalagmites, two of which are at the foot broken and skewed. The bottom of the input shaft descends to the lowest part of the area where in the winter cold air is trapped and in the summer air is cooled by the night temperatures. Because of this calcite formations have special gray color and shape. After 80 m, the input shaft ends, ascents and tightens into a side niche, called Samotarjeva Molilnica (Loner’s  Oratory).
Cave path then leads through the Šipka Pass (Bypass) into the Šipka gorge, 20 m long section of the cave, strewn with a multitude of large stalagmites, where the cave and outside air are mixing. Šipka (bramble) is an old name for this part of the cave because of coral-like growths on the walls and dripstones.
Passage then drops slightly and outside air can no longer be felt but instead there’s warmer and always moist cave air.  Soon passage widens to 40 m long Hall of King Matjaž (a.k.a. Rešaver Hall), with impressive dripstones and mighty fallen stalagmite named King Matjaž (Gospodaric called it Harambaša) and above it there’s stalagmite King Samo (also known for some time as a monument of Tegethoff). On the wall is a beautiful white Savica Waterfall. At the bottom of the hall there’s landslip Pekel (Hell) and from there tunnel branches to  Little cave, which Žiberna called Art Museum.
The main tunnel then narrows into the 30 m long Gorge of Waterfalls (Hallway), where it narrows to a width of 5m, with typical calcite waterfalls on the side walls. The tunnel will soon expand and rise into the 70 m long Calvary (Gospodaric called it Pretner Hall), which is characterized by slope with a forest of stalagmites and columns. Here are the cave path splits - on the left side of Calvary the principal route runs at the foot of the slope while on the right hand side it raises and drops again to join the main left path.
Tourist cave path continues to the edge of the Belvedere lookout, where the view opens to the Great Hall, as was dubbed by Tentava and comrades. The tunnel is 100m long, up to 40 m wide and up to 20m high. Nowadays it is called Žiberna Hall. Path then descends sharply to the bottom of the hall, which is also the lowest point of the cave, 72 m lower and 500 m far from the entrance. Here is a passage to the 20 m deep narrow pit. On the way there’s an interesting stalagmite that Tentava named Attila's pipe. Tourist trail rises again to the Turkish graveyard where on the right side road branches off to Pearl Vilenica and Treasury with many white-red curtains and large crystals. The main trail splits again in the upper part of the hall. On the right hand side there’s steep tunnel, once called Štefanija balcony, and on the left side a beautiful rockfall with stalactite groups, Crown Hill, and Crown Prince Rudolf Monument. The cave ends with a raised tunnel called Heaven or Paradise and with Heaven organ.
In the hall of King Matjaž with the branch to the Little cave, which was called by Tentava the Art Museum, the cave trail is only transitive over a bridge across the abyss of Hell which is up to 10 m deep with a 30 m long tunnel at the bottom. Little cave is 60 m long, planted with many beautiful calcite forms: Mummies stalagmites, Cypress and China vase, while on the side hangs a large canopy, from which the stalactite Elephant Trunk grows. Passage ends with a landslip, called the Catacombs.
The entire length of the Divaca cave is 700 m and it is 95 m deep. There are 1500 m of visitor’s route, but it is seldom open for visitors. For more information about visiting contact the administrator, the Speleological Society Gregor Žiberna in Divaca.

The entrance to the Divaca Cave is easily accessible from the road Divaca - Lokev na Krasu - Lipica, where after a kilometer or two outside Divaca a roadside sign will direct you to the right. Very soon you’ll arrive to the parking space (waypoint PARK). From there one has to walk for a few meters into the karst sinkhole at the bottom of which the entrance to the cave is (waypoint CAVE).
To register this EarthCache you must answer the following questions:
1.       Assess the dimensions (depth and diameter) of the sinkhole in which the entrance to the cave is.
2.       End of the Divaca Cave (Heaven = Nebesa) extends almost to another cave nearby, but is approximately 50 m below it. Which cave is this?
3.       How many steps are there on the staircase to the iron gate that closes the entrance to the cave? Count all steps not just the metal ones.
4.       Optionally, take a photo of yourself or your GPS and attach it to your log.
Send your answers through my GC profile. After that you can log your visit, don't wait for permission from me. If you took photos, attach them to your log.
